text: Always a pleasure to dine here. Food is fresh and service is fast and courteous. We love the all you can eat sushi. This is definitely one of our favorite restaurants in town.

We've eaten at this little gem at the (far)western edge of Cheyenne Ave.  For those you you sushi mavens out there who do not live in the area, let me assure you that the trip is well worth the "trouble". Their sushi has been uniformly fresh and delicious every time we've gone. Their cooked dishes have been wonderful as well.  We've enjoyed their creations for both lunch and dinner.  The service has always been professional.  Just one word of advice GO!!!
Sushi Bomb is definitely my go to sushi spot!! The place is very stylish and serve great quality food! The service is very friendly, and I would recommend this place to everyone!!

PAUL puts the BOMB in Sushi Bomb !!!!! It was our first time there and we were a little confused on what to order. Paul gave us all his recommendations from every section of the menu!!! It was amazing food and great service! I would highly recommend Sushi Bomb and Paul made our experience 100% better!!

Decent food, pretty fresh. Terrible service...had to ask for the simplist things multiple times. Just getting our miso soup took 20 minutes in a mostly empty resturaunt. Very inexperienced servers. Would not recommend and will not come again.

We came here on a recommendation from a friend, it was close to my parent's house so we didn't have to travel very far, and we didn't want to wait very long to be seated.   In the beginning service was slow. They had a party of 12 that was here before us but they were getting dessert after we sat down for about 10 minutes. Seemed like they were more attentive after I whipped out my yelp coupon for free draft beer for checking in. It   Nigiri definitely has way too much rice on it. The fish was pretty fresh but sliced so paper thin I could see through it. Almost like they were trying to ration their fish.   When the server delivered our combo tempura a freaking ant came with it!!!   They don't do half rolls unless it's your very last roll. The rolls are the standard portion of rice but some looked scaled down.   In the end the menu is pretty large with a lot of variety just don't expect large portions.   Would I come back? Probably not due to the traveling distance.

Although the food is tasty the menu is unclear and the "alll you can eat" is hardly all you can eat!! There are loop holes all over the menu that limit what you can choose and how much you can have!  The dessert is apparently one item per person although it is not stated anywhere!! In addition there are items reserved for dinner only but it is listed nowhere on the menu that they are off limits for lunch. I will not be visiting this establishment in the future.

I was there for business lunch and we were the only ones there. I know it's not that busy but the sushi guy just sat at the table on the phone and one of his shoes off. It was unprofessional. I sat at the bar but the server had to take my order which I have no problem with but clearly she was doing something else in the back. I'm not gonna try to get his attention  if I need anything. Food was good.get a star for food.

I absolutely loved my first visit to Sushi Bomb! I had the "Hooters" roll twice, the "Japanese" and "Korean" rolls, and finished up with their plum ice cream for dessert. I cannot wait until I visit Sushi Bomb again!
Slooow service! Doesn't matter if you call ahead and order pick up they will have you waiting! Waste my whole lunch break waiting for food!

This has been my regular sushi place for about a year and I have never been disappointed. The menu and food are pretty decent and the service is always good. Their AYCE is definitely worth it. I would definitely recommend giving them a try.

Very good bento boxes. Sushi was fresh and checking in gets you a free beer which is cool. I think the sashimi dishes could be a bit bigger for the price. For 13 or 14 dollars only 6 thin slices is not a great deal.

Very good sushi! All you can eat is the way to go but always order 4 rolls at a time so you don't wait to long. The rolls are nice and tight with very good flavor. This place is highly recommended! The only reason I give them a 3 star is because our first time there nobody acknowledged us for 10 min after seating us, we had to get up and walk away!

By far, the best sushi restaurant in town!  My best friend and I have been coming here once a month for about 10 months. We've never had an issue with the service, but a couple of months ago, a new guy and he's been our waiter the last two times--he's hilarious! Upbeat, energetic and funny!   The rolls just can't be beat. They are all delicious, our favorite being Sex on the Beach and One Night Stand. There was one roll that we had never tried before, The Red Tiger, but our server insisted we try it a couple months ago and it's now another one of our favorites. Last month when we were in, he remembered what we ordered, which is always nice. A lot of their rolls are spicy, but that's fine for us--we love spicy foods.  Two large-screen TVs are really nice during football season too. The staff is really good about letting you pick what channel you want to watch.  I have tried a few other sushi places in town (Sushi Bomb isn't around the corner from my house, so when I go out with my daughter, we try places near home) and I always end up not liking the other places and I always compare them to Sushi Bomb. Nothing compares.  For the price and the service and the flavor and variety, I can't find a better place in town. So delicious.

The place is cute neighbor restaurant.  It was a Saturday night and the place was half full.  I expected it to be busier.   The food was not what I wanted.  It seemed to me the majority of the rolls had either eel in them or they were spicy.  I can't stand eel and my best friend doesn't eat spicy so we really had a problem looking at what rolls to eat.  We asked if we could sub spicy tuna for regular tuna and the server didn't understand what we were saying.  I had major issues with the service but will get to that later.  Back to the food....we ordered tempura which pieces were so undercooked we couldn't eat it.   Seriously, I have no idea what veggie it was.   It was like a rock.  The rolls were so so.  Nothing stood out.   Ok I understand they had some issues with service being bad.  Being in the industry I consider myself a little more patient than others.  It wasn't like they ignored us, it was the complete opposite.  I couldn't finish a sentence without them coming and asking us how everything was.   We told them to leave the menus, 3 different people tried to take them.   I asked them questions about the menu and they had no idea what some of the items were.  I couldn't wait to get out of there.   Personally, I love it that they asked how we were doing but really, every 2 minutes.  Annoying.   They need to find a balance with the service.
I've only ordered sushi to go from Sushi Bomb, but the sushi was fresh and very good. They made my order quickly and the prices are reasonable.

Sushi Bomb was ok. If you're going to get your roll fix, this will do, but the nigiri is much to be desired. My husband and I tried it a week ago while we were in the area and weren't impressed with the nigiri. The service was fast and the rolls fine, but the nigiri was cut so thin that all I could taste was rice. We did all you can eat, but I gave up quickly because it wasn't worth it. I was hoping this would be my new sushi place since it's close to my house, but not so much.

Came to the restaurant expecting a great time considering the various positives reviews I've heard about it. Was given the opposite: gross dining conditions, rude waiters/waitresses, and an even ruder manager. Will not be returning.

Was just there this past weekend for the first time. Went for the AYCE and it did not disappoint. The sushi rolls are really good. Try the canyon, mountain and volcano. We are definitely making this place our sushi spot. Service was good. We had a waiter and a waitress. Waitress was very warm, attentive and friendly. Overall, this place is worth trying if you are looking for a new sushi spot. Can't wait 'til next time.

First off, id like to start off by saying I NEVER come on yelp to complain, generally, I am always giving out excellent reviews, but this experience was BEYOND unacceptable I felt I needed to share. First and foremost my family comes to sushi bomb OFTEN at least 3 times a month. My mom asked me to go with to try out the place. We had 13 people total and out of the 13, 10 of us were all you can eat, our bill was over 400 dollars. AYCE for almost 30 dollars a piece was definitely not worth it when you can find it cheaper with WAY better service. The service here was literally by far the worst service I have ever received at a sushi restaurant! My son is only 3 years old and they took a while to bring out his sushi so he took ONE and I mean ONE piece of my sushi and they literally came up to me and told me he cannot share off of me. Seriously, how much can a 3 year old eat from my plate? I ordered him his entire own roll but it was taking a while to come and I'm not going to sit there and watch my son starve as we are all eating. After that, they also scolded my 7 year old who ate 3 edamames from my sisters AYCE. Seriously 3 edamames. It was honestly so disrespectful. And to top it off, they wanted to charge us for 6 pieces of sushi that was left out of 10 AYCE!!! Seriously??? The bill is over 400 bucks and you want to charge us over 6 pieces of uneaten sushi? That is absolutely ridiculous. My husband was forced to eat the last 6 pieces and literally came home and vomited. Another thing that upset me was that I guess they have 2 dollar draft Sapporo for AYCE. They failed to tell us that until the very end after we had ordered 30 dollars in regular Sapporo not knowing the draft was INCREDIBLY cheaper. They're money hungry and don't care at all about service, only the money they can take from your pocket. It's ridiculous the way they treated me and my family considering the amount we were spending plus 18% tip. They need waaay better service. Sushi was ok, just like every other place here in Vegas, nothing OUT OF THIS WORLD, by any means. Take your money else where with better service and better sushi. Also waitresses jasmine and jen were incredibly disrespectful and need to reconsider their positions as waitresses. They have lost a total of 18 people's business! Way to go sushi bomb

I have been coming here for years and I've always loved it here. It is by far my favorite place to grab some sushi and hang out with friends and drink. I don't know how long they have had the AYCE, but i know its been awhile now. They never had it a couple years ago. The service is always good when I've been here. My favs are the special d rolls, x-girlfriend rolls, and the bacon wrapped scallops.
Really enjoyed my visit to sushi bomb. Its got good atmosphere and the $1.99 all you can drink Sapporo is a big plus!
By far one of the best AYCE sushi in Las Vegas! Great customer service and the food is fresh!
Hands down the best AYCE I've been to with tons of different option and out server Jenn was super friendly and helpful....
A+ food for the price. It's a little far from the strip but this is probably the best all you can eat sushi in the city.

I've been to a handful of AYCE sushi places in Vegas, and this is one of my all-time favorites. The pork belly is better than any other I've tried-- it melts in your mouth! The monkey brain is also a must-order.   The staff is very friendly, and they get the sushi to you in good time. I've been here quite a few times, and the company I've brought always finds it to be a great place too.

This place is so good, I love the atmosphere and the staff. So friendly, always makes us feel welcome. The food is awesome! I always do all you can eat and you can't  beat the options you have to enjoy. Your seated pretty quickly no matter how busy it is. They are so nice, whenever they see my 4 year old... they do little things to make her smile. Like letting her play with the stuff on the counter or giving her a sushi sucker every time we leave. Great food awesome staff, I'd recommend this place to all my sushi lovers.
Comfy, fish is  pretty good, definitely good enuf ( I'm here on a Sunday ) , nice local neighborhood spot... very casual, cute place, worth it if u live nearby
So happy we found this place!! My husband had the Sushi Bomb roll and I had the Steak Hibachi.  The food was excellent and the staff very friendly. We will definitely be back!!

Visited Sushi Bomb for the first time couple days ago during lunch time and I love it the waiter John was very nice and attentive. I had the deep fried Sibuya Roll which was recommended to me by John and it was amazing. i will be definitely going back soon for the amazing food and Great waiter.
All you can eat $25. How could you go wrong? The sushi is very good. And the hot food as well.

I love this place. We are regulars here almost on a weekly basis. The people are lovely and the atmosphere is relaxing. If you're hungry go for the all you can eat at $27 per person. It's worth it! I highly recommend this place. My favorite roll is the tiger roll.

I tried this place last year when it didn't offer AYCE and I liked it a lot.  I was excited to go back now that they offer AYCE, so I could try more rolls and see if their quality was still good.    And I was happy to find out -- it is!  We gave them a visit the other night and tried about nine different rolls between us... and I can't think of one thing to complain about on any of them.  Very fresh and VERY yummy.  I also thought the service was excellent.  They were great at keeping the rolls coming out one at a time, with no big lags between them.  They were also very friendly and didn't give us attitude (as some places do) when we wanted to order more.  I love the ambiance of this place, too.  Sure it's in a strip mall just like all of the other sushi places in Vegas, but the decor is really cute and the tables/chairs are nice and comfy. And even though the place was full, it wasn't too noisy at all.  There are only a couple small things that knock this rating down to a 4 from a 5 for me.  One... they don't allow you to order half-rolls, except for your very last order, which kinda bugs me.  And although they do let you order anything on the menu, their appetizer list is extreeeemely small.  I think they only offered 4-5 things.    Other than those small things, though, Sushi Bomb really was great!  We'll be going back again when our AYCE sushi craving hits and we want to stay on this side of town.

I had heard so many good things about this place from two coworkers so I couldn't wait to eat there, took my boyfriend for his birthday instead of our usual spot because we were expecting something great and it was the complete opposite of great .   Service was HORRIBLE. Place had about three other tables pretty slow and still we couldn't get good service can't imagine it slammed . My daughter was with us she loves sushi and I had to wave a server down for children's chopsticks . We felt rush the whole time , and we had our server switch tables with another server and both of them forgot about us , basically had to wave people down the whole time , which made me feel like I was being a B**ch but I wasn't , I just wanted good service , I serve and partially manage in a fast paced restaurant and that was not a good experience .   Food was just okay

Came out here for Mother's Day. Ordered Tempura Udon, four variety sushi role, my boyfriend loved the bacon roll, seaweed salad, and a bottle of lychee sake. It was a packed day but the wait was 2 minutes. The waiters were very nice and friendly. One waiter, he was eager to clear out our table that he took my daughter's plate and she wasn't even done eating.  We didn't say anything to him, he seemed like he was distracted. Overall, good food, pricing is fair for sushi.
Your new menu is the worst. I used to love you. You've let me down. Never have I been so dissatisfied by restaurant that I had to write a review.... I'm sorry but I don't love you anymore :-(

Pros:  Good food, AYCE.  Cons:  Awful horrible service.  Honestly my FIRST negative review on Yelp.  The service was that bad that I could not let it go and to inform others. Literally read reviews from 2 months ago complaining about the same thing.  Let me preface that we came in a whole hour before closing which is decent time to order and eat, so I understood that last call for food was 30 min before closing.  Our server was just impatient, rude, and unhappy.  It was to the point I almost wanted to have her sit down and breath and talk about why it seems she hates her job so much to make the customers feel so uncomfortable and awkward.  The sushi men behind the bar we're irritated and unhappy, as if they we're pissed we came in since they seemed they wanted to close up early and go home.  It just felt we we're a burden to the whole staff.  We wished we could have left earlier, after an $80 bill for 2 people with poor service, I didn't want to even tip. Everyone is in customer service in some way, no need to be so unpleasant to people who want to have a nice dinner.  I MIGHT give a 2nd chance to see if there is any improvement, but honestly would rather drive the extra 7 miles to Chinatown for better service than have that experience again.  I would never recommend this place to anyone.  The bad service just trumps the good food.. honestly that ridiculous.  Recommendation to management:  Please properly train your staff to wait on tables in a friendly manner, not in a "hurry up and eat you food" type of way.     Customers, you have been warned.

As soon as we arrive the chef prepares our favorite dish, Salmon Sushi.  When we sit down a few moments later our server sets the freshly prepared Sushi in front of us. The few seconds it takes to walk in the door and sit down, we already got food in front of us.  This has to be the best feeling ever, the fact that they remember us and care enough to begin to prepare our favorite dish is awesome!  Thats how it starts, let me tell you how it ends. Next we order! More Salmon Sushi! Check! A some some roll. Check! Salmon cheese sticks. Check! Baja Yellowtail roll. Check! Throw in some Salmon hand rolls. Double Check!! Rinse and repeat until full! We do the All You Can Eat, its so worth it.  Our favorite servers? You ask.  Hmmm  let me think. Gots to be a tie between Paul or Danny.   Pauls got the hair, but Danny is always on it. Its truly a tie between them, they are both great.   Now the bad, peak times like friday nights or saturday nights get a little hectic. So sometimes you have to be patient and wait for a table.   We usually try to go midday for lunch or late for dinner, 8'tish or after.  Thank you
awesome sushi and great staff! the Orange blossom roll is amazing, have to give a try!

Sushi Bomb is my favorite Sushi place I've found. My husband and I love to take our friends and family there to show it off. We love going for lunch, All You Can Eat for $19.95. Ask for the spicy edamame, not on the menu, but so worth it. This Guy, Love Affair, Sushi Bomb, and Ex-Girlfriend are just some of our favorites. If you are in the NW area and want some fantastic, fresh sushi, you've gotta check out Sushi Bomb. It even beats our fave place from when we lived in So Cal.

This use to be one of my favorite places for sushi and I eat there at least once a week but in the last month I have been super disappointed with the service.  The food is good when you actually get it and by that I mean that trying to get someone to take your order is becoming impossible.  Today I went and there was 1 other table of 2 eating and it took me 25 minutes to get my order taken.  There were 2 in my party and when the other person ordered, the waitress started to walk away so I said wait I need to order as well. I got the roll I ordered and my daughter got 2 of the 2 things she ordered but the rest never came.  We finished our food and she never once came by to check on us until she brought the bill.  I wasn't charged for it but I hate ordering stuff and not getting it.  This has been an issue I have had too many times so I think it's time for a break and a new place.

Told them we had a few people meeting us in a few minutes, they wouldn't serve us until everyone was there. Apparently they time you to the second and it'd be too hard to figure out.  Ridiculously unyielding. Will not add or substitute anything. For instance, they have an avocado asparagus roll yet will not add either to a menu item.  Had a couple people in our party ordering ayce and a younger teenager ordering ala cart. The appetizer portions are different sizes depending on how you order. The waitress freaked when the teenager started eating the wrong order.........didn't make sense, especially since the ayce order was smaller!!!  Sasa Sushi is just a few miles down the road, a place where the staff is waaay more friendly and they aren't worried about customizing an order for you.

This is my local sushi place and I'm a fan. The sushi quality is very good and they have a decent sake and beer selection. I'm the first to admit that the service can be hit and miss, but I'm not bothered by speaking up and asking for something. We usually eat at the bar when here and get plenty of attention.
This place rocks!  Great fish and great prices and the people working there make your experience fun.  Ask D for his secret monkey ball roll or ask for the off-menu garlic edamame!

We usually come here every 2 weeks or so. The service was always great. The staff was always friendly and attentive.  I guess they are under new management and they cleaned house. We came in tonight with new servers and staff. Our male server was a complete jerk from the beginning. He never smiled at us. When we all said we were doing "all you can eat," he didn't believe us. He told us 20 minutes later that the kitchen was closing, but they weren't closing for another 45 minutes? Hmmm. He was totally rushing for us to leave. There was a female server that was helping him out--she was nice, but that's the only good thing i have to say about our experience.  All the while, while this was all happening, the owner was just sitting at a table just staring at us eat. Knowing we were unhappy about the service, and complaining to the female server, not once did he care to talk to us. Like a coward, he just sat from afar and stared.  Servers are supposed to earn their tips. That's why we eat out because we are paying for the service. We won't be back and i suggest no one else should if service like this continues.

We usually go to Goyemon but wanted to try somewhere new where we don't have to wait in line for an hour on weekend night. The quality of fish was good and I liked their small rice portion. My favorite was raw oysters, they were so fresh!! We will definitely visit again.

This is my new sushi spot!! The owner Su is very nice and was  very helpful from the moment we sat down.  We went on a Monday evening around 9PM and it was busy with about 6 tables.  There are 12 in the room plus the sushi bar.  We ordered all you can eat Sushi for $25.99 and for $3.99 more we had all you can drink beer (Saparo).    The sushi rolls were huge!! I've had Sushi Mon AYCE and the sushi is smaller/scaled down for AYCE patrons.  This sushi was huge!! Everything on the menu from appetizers to desserts and regular to special sushi rolls are includedin AYCE, except for Sashimi.    Over all the ambiance was very nice and clean.  The service was excellent.  I will be making this a regular spot!  I posted several pics!

Update :   Would like to point out, that I am no fan of all you can eat, all you can drink, which some others list as their main reason for coming here.  Ask the chefs for their recommendations, based on the freshest ingredients, and you will not be disappointed.  The new menu tries to go a bit beyond California Roll, and if you are able to indicate to the chefs the flavors you like, they will deliver.  Be a bit bold, try something new, and understand that on your way, you may discover new favorites, as well as definitive No's.

Discovered this place August 2nd. Been there 3 times since. All you can eat (which I recommend) variety is delicious. And the service is faster than any other sushi place I've been to in vegas, and la. Hands down favorite sushi spot in Vegas out of the 7 or so places I've tried out here.
The name said it all...it's the bomb! Got the taster and lord was delicious! Wanted to try more but was full already

As a new lover of Sushi this was my first time! We chose to sit at the bar. The staff is very attentive and polite. I tried the catepillar first and my taste buds were screaming. I don't have a favorite because every roll I try here I love! We even got a delicious honeybread dessert. The decor is just darling as well. Guess you will just have to see for yourself!

Absolutely terrible. I honestly can't even figure out why they're still open. Three people got the all you can eat. The waitress was extremely rude, her name was Hee. She messed up our orders, and it took forever for everything to come out we ended up only getting 3 orders before they put the bill on our table after killing so much time on the order before having it come out. We probably waited 20 minutes for 1 roll to come out. When it came time to pay they also messed this up and couldn't figure out how to split a bill. This was absolutely terrible. Do not go.

Food is not bad but the severe is awful. I've been to sushi bomb twice, and both times I had terrible service! The servers are extremely rude and they stand behind you, and just watch you eat! At first, I thought maybe it was a language barrier but as they continued to slam the plates down, not bring the food we ordered, and could careless to refill our drinks, I figured out it wasn't the language. I feel like there's so many good sushi places in vegas, that they need to improve to stay open. BE CAREFUL, cause they added extra items on our bill.

Great sushi.  The staff is always super friendly and fast. It's defiantly worth a try. The Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna is amazing as well other unique rolls. They also have a great selection of non-sushi items.
Sushi was decent. Not a place I would probably choose and/or recomend to anyone, but you may have a different take on the place.

This is my all time favorite sushi place in Vegas! The price may be a bit more than others, but it's worth it. The quality of their fish along with great staff creates the best sushi experience that I've ever had. I've been to many sushi restaurants around Vegas, and no other places top this one. I highly recommend to give Sushi Bomb a try!

Out of al sushi restaurants in my area, this is the place I frequently go to. Since, it isn't a large restaurant there is usually a wait, but not long at all. The quality of the sushi is good and they have a good variety of choices. The crispy rice topped with spicy tuna is always good. I've been here for lunch and dinner and always done the ayce. The service is quick, even when it's busy. It's a great neighborhood sushi spot!
Best sushi around. High quality ingredients. Outstanding customer service. Hard to go other places.

This is my favorite sushi place. They speak english very well and i never have a problem with trying to converse with the workers. The dining area is always clean. after another table leaves, i tend to see how long it takes the workers to clean up after them and they're on it immediately. Love that! They have an awesome Mexican roll and Tiger roll that are to die for. Can't forget the miso soup!!! Best sushi place I've been to by far!!!

If I could give this place zero stars I would. The service does suck. My friend and I walk in and no one greets us. We stand there for a few minutes and no one comes to seat us. We eventually ourselves at the bar and still nothing - not even the sushi chefs say hi. Are we ghosts? Eventually a waitress comes over with utensils but by that time my friend is done and we just leave.   Come on people, how do you expect to run a successful business this way? My god!
Very nice place. Food is awesome and service was very professional. Will be back soon and bring my friends!!!

It's been super busy every time I come in here but the service is attentive and quick. They don't take reservations on the weekends but the wait isn't too bad. Their snow rabbit and orange blossom is to die for. I come in here about once every 2 weeks but if I could I would come in every week!!! I've been to many ayce in vegas but sushi bomb has always been consistent in service and quality. I love their tempura banana split dessert.

Decided to try this place because it's so close to my house. The verdict: I'll continue to drive across town to my usual, quality, sushi spot. Was disappointed in the fish which did not taste fresh & the service was just okay. One thing that really bothered me was after I got my check & I left the amount plus tip in cash-I wasn't even out the door when the server rushed to the table to make sure I paid. Cmon.

Wow!!!! Great food, excellent service. Family of three tried all different items and each one was fantastic. Clam miso was great! Veggie tempura was awesome, and the blue fin, seared tuna and poke were phenomenal.
Been to several sushi places in town and this one is by far my favorite. We always do the AYCE and you have the majority of the menu as options. The variety is great and the service is fast.
actually really good sushi, they even had upon ramen. nice hidden gem. very friendly staff, can't wait to try more of their sushi rolls.

Writing this as my husband is throwing up his lovely dinner at this Venue. (Sarcasm when I say lovely) We used to love the food here and unfortunately it has declined along with the service. Did not eat some of our pieces of fish as it was below par yet told we would be charged. If you want side dishes those are still pretty good but if you are going for real sushi I would pass. I don't see how this place has such positive reviews with such low quality fish. Literally giving it two stars solely because of the appetizers.
This was some of the best and drag sushi I've ever eaten in Vegas. The miso soup is absolutely amazing would absolutely go back and I will be back! Great service as well!!
I enjoyed lunch here with two friends. We each chose something different and we all enjoyed our selection. Service was good and the ambience was good. We'll be back.

Ok I have known this place for a long time. All these people that are rating 5 stars have NEVER had good sushi because the fish is mushy. The service is great because there is no one there. The place sucks. This place is a horrible place. The next day I had a bomb.
Really great sushi!  Just wish there was more selections on the baked section of sushi.

This place has tasty sushi and chicken entree dishes. My husband and I got the sushi bomb specialty roll, and spicy chicken entree and both tasted delish. Service is excellent, and the staff was friendly and attentive. The only negative was the menu a la carte seemed pricey. I'm not one to get AYCE meals, so my only suggestion is to offer a HH for the a la carte patrons and that'd be perfect. All in all, my husband and I will be back and enjoyed our meals.

Every time I come into Sushi Bomb we have always had great, and timley service. Their spicy edemme is so yummy, and the sushi rolls are by far the best in town. I also like how close it is to my house. :)
Love that there's a decent sushi spot so close to my house! I've always had a positive experience at sushi bomb!

We decided to try this AYCE lunch special- $21 each before 3 PM- because this place is very close to where we live. The seating area is very small, but wasn't crowded, which was nice. The walls inside were painted with large fish and the decor was all cohesive. Now for the food!  We ordered an order of seaweed salad, veggie tempura, and calamari tempura. All were good.  For rolls, I ordered a Monster roll, a Snow Rabbit, and something else with lots of eel. I can't remember the name! My girlfriend started off with one order of some roll comprised of deep fried banana, sweet potato, and crunchy onions. We stopped there for rolls because we aren't great at AYCE sushi just yet.   After we finished our rolls, we ordered dessert. I got tempura red bean icecream and she got honey toast! Both were quite larger than I was expecting and the tempura icecream really hit the spot for me.   I added everything up and if we were going a la carte, we'd have spent a little more than double what we paid in the end.  Good servers, and a good option outside of Chinatown!

Food 2 stars - their deep fried rolls are soggy Service 0 star - the guy taking our order stopped me half way thru taking my order to go pour tea for another table. What I love the most is that I ordered 3 rolls and they gave me 1 pack of soy sauce and NO WASABI!!!!! WTF!!!!!!!!
Server asked if cust wanted table or bar customer asked table and he said well there only two of you go to bar.  What the hell???? I can tell service will.suck!!!!!!

We finally stopped going after our last visit in early July 2013. We went in for lunch, ayce as we usually do and have done some 50-60 visits since 2010.  One of you younger sushi chefts, usually very unfriendly and sarcastic, refused to make us the last item we ordered.  When we inquired, he said he was too busy.  There were only two other sets of customers in the entire place.  While we enjoyed some of the items they made, there are much better and less costly places nearby.  This place is totally lacking in customer service, especially when you have customers such as us that had been frequented the place so much.  Obviously the owner does not care as I have never seen any replies to any type of bad review.  We just decided to not give our business to someone that does not appreciate it.  We now enjoy a much better setting with better food at less price, and the owner and employees appreciate the business every time.
Sushi Bomb is AWESOME!!  Fresh Fresh Fresh!!  Friendly staff!!  Recommend to EVERYONE!!!!
Have been coming here for years.  Never disappoints.  Always good.  Very fresh sushi, great service!  Usually gets busy at night.  Take out is done well too.
good quality fish and awesome atmosphere! our server's name was Sung In  and he was very friendly.

If you are looking for great sushi, definitely give this place a try!  The menu is extensive, the food is delicious, and the wait staff for most part is friendly, but the best part...it's all you can eat.  We eat there more often than we should (at least once per week),  but it's hard to resist, and we've never had a bad experience.  I would recommend lunch or an early dinner visit, because the restaurant fills up quickly, and you may have to wait a bit to place another order if you are doing all you can eat.

New to the city and tried several sushi places and by far Sushi Bomb on top of my list. Food, service and staff are excellent.  Definitely coming back and may be my spot for sushi and highly recommend this place.

I was seated at the sushi bar and I tried the "Tonight" roll and it is one of the best rolls I have had in a while.came out quickly and I ordered it again.  I also had the white tuna 2 piece, salmon 2 piece and tuna 2 pieces they came out about average thickness compared to the other local places. The fish taste fresh and was not served with a hand full of rice   I used the restroom which was well maintained and clean the service was good I will definitely be back

The atmosphere is casual. The waitstaff friendly. The food is very good, and tastes pretty darn fresh. This isn't the coast, after all. But I have been to Sushi Bomb several times and I highly recommend it!

If I could give Sushi Bomb 10 Stars I would !!! This place has NEVER gone downhill like EVERY OTHER sushi place in town. Always quality fish ... fresh fresh fresh !!! Our server Jennifer is the "bomb baby !!" If I had a restaurant I'd steal her !! My favorites ?? Dancing Spider for appetizer. Omg the best. My hubby and I order several different types of sushi and they bring it out on one large platter. That's the way to go if you don't want to be overstuffed. The fish v rice portions are perfect. Get the sushi bomb roll to seal the deal. My forever favorite sushi restaurant !!!

I've been eating here for several years now and every time, the quality of the sushi improves. It has easily become my favorite all you can eat sushi option. They offer more than sushi if you have those silly friends who don't eat it and now with the half roll option, you get to try even more! They lose a star because quite honestly, if it wasn't for their hard working helper John, who kicks ass and makes up for most of their shortcomings, their service isn't fabulous. A little slow and not always friendly.... but the food is great and worth a slightly curt server.
This place has alright sushi. Eh... I've had better... The only roll I liked was the dancing eel roll. Calamari had no taste I would say the same for the chicken karaa-ge.

Checked out this place for a Sunday dinner service. Family of 4 including 2 young kids. The ambience is average and the place is a little more than average noise level.   After being seated, a server came over to ask for drink orders. When I paused to breathe, she took that as taking too long and walked away. This actually happened a second time as I was asking my kids what they wanted and that took too long for her. On her third arrival at the table, I literally had to ask her to give us 30 seconds to answer her questions before she walks away again.   So we ordered 2 kids meals and 2 AYCE. The server  was at least helpful in explaining how their AYCE works e.g. which items were excluded or limited to one.   I found it a little off-putting to have her emphasize to us the kids can't share our food. This was as they were dropping food off to the table and the kids meals still waiting to be done. I totally get that a business doesn't want to have people abuse the AYCE rules, but I highly doubt 2 little kids are going to eat them into bankruptcy.   Then I ordered one thing only to have the wrong item brought to the table. When it was mentioned to the server, he shrugged his shoulders and left it on the table anyway.   When asked to speak with a manager, surprisingly none on site! Can't say that I didn't see that one coming.   It's a shame because the food is good and there is a decent selection. They do seem to err on more spicy oriented special rolls. Which is how they got a second star from me.   Definitely not very family friendly in my opinion. So won't be back. I recommend you save yourself a bad experience like we had and it spoiled a nice time out with my family.
This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in town. The fish is always fresh and the service from Jennifer is always on par.  You won't be disappointed.

Love the friendly staff at Sushi Bomb, always giving excellent and expedited service. I love the combination bento's and fine other dishes.  Easy to locate off the 215 and Cheyenne and lots of parking.  Nice décor too.

We had 2 amazing experiences here and we loved most of the things we tried but the service and "policies" aren't in favor of the customer. You cannot upgrade your a la carte item to all you can eat...even if it's on the menu as an all you can eat option. They charge for tiny amounts of leftover food, even though it wasn't prepared properly. Such a bummer because the fish is fresh.
Absolutely incredible sushi!..the sushi bomb roll was hands down the best! Service was good and atmosphere was nice. We will make this our weekly Tuesday date night spot
All you can eat ! 27$  Good food / fresh / Clean / food come quick.  I love Oyster  ( Big and Fresh )

Have been hitting the sushi Places a bit lately.. I have to say this place was pretty good and had a varied menu of stuff with some really good spicy options. It didnt blow me away but was above average for sure. I would recommend for a good
This place was awesome. Great service. Great food. The screaming O salad and the crazy jalapeño are my favorite. The Mohave beach roll was really good too!!! It's a bit small inside. But that's okay.
Awesome!  Everything tasted really good and the food kept coming.  I will be back next time I am in Vegas.  Good stuff!

Its my first time in this sushi place they got a good and fresh sushi they treated us like a regular staff are nice And the dessets are awsome... I am will rilly gonna come back to this place :-) :-) :-)

Visited this sushi restaurant this evening and half way through our meal we noticed the chefs was not wearing any gloves ir skin protection he continue to wipe his forehead, nose and sneezing, then proceeded to check the sharpness of his knife i was applauded and sickened after this moment, their all you can eat was very limited and services was sluggish. the chef was watching more tv game then preparing the food he continue to use his bare hands to push up the bridge of his glasses and wiping his nose right at the bar..ugh first visit.. last visit

Cozy little sushi joint with great decor and friendly staff. The wooden wall gives an added ambiance to enjoy your dining experience. Yummy sushi to make my tummy happy AND so close to home for an added home run!
by far the rudest staff and most unprofessional service. would never recommend this to a friend I wanted to keep.

Today was my first visit to Sushi Bomb for lunch. I ordered AYCE at the lunch special price of $20.95 ($6 savings from the dinner price).   I definitely treated myself and ordered a ton of food! I had to start with edamame, shrimp tempura, and miso soup.  I ordered about 4 rolls too, but my favorite was the Monster roll! The flavors were perfect!   The service is decent, and the staff is usually always friendly.   For dessert, I prefer the fried green tea I've cream or plain green tea. So delicious!   I'll definitely be back!
I came here expecting a great dinner, instead I am burdened by nausea and disappointment. Crowded dining conditions, rude waiters and waitresses, sushi tasted like straight up ass.

Yet another soulless Korean pseudo sushi disaster trying to act like an authentic Sushi restaurant. Food: Below average, lots of stupid sounding mayo & fried food filled garbage advertised as specialty rolls. The actual fish sushi like Hamachi, Tuna, Albacore is cut so paper thin it looks like deli meat. the rice is dry, cold & tasteless.   The service was horrible, unfortunately we were a group of 7 and they automatically charge gratuitiy for parties of 5 or more. So obviously the staff already knowing their getting their tip are very rude and indifferent. I really resisted the urge of throwing our waiter through the window, he was a cocky, unpleasant, rude little punk with an attitude problem & acted like he was doing us a favor by serving us.   With all the amazing sushi places here in Las Vegas, I suggest you avoid this place unless you have low expectations for quality of food and a high tolerance for poor service.

My husband and I came in for lunch. It was pretty slow and they seated us quickly. The hostess didn't seem all that enthusiastic to be there, but did her job. We didn't feel pressured, but we did both order the all you can eat and were aware of the 50 minute time. The menu changed a bit since the last time we were here and they altered a few names so ordering with a little confusing. The menu change seems like they added a lot of new items, which is great. Our orders came out pretty quickly, but we should have taken advantage of the half order rolls at the end since we were stuffed and felt pressure to clean our plates (our fault for ordering a bunch at once). Our favorites were the crunchy rice with salmon, Wild West, super white, tuna poke, monkey brains, and Mojave beach roll. The worst was the New Mexican roll, the habanero sauce was good and super spicy, but such an odd flavoring with the cilantro. We had mochi ice cream (coffee and cookies and cream), which were delicious even though we were so stuffed! Lunch was $21.
Love sushi bomb!!! Food is so good and cooks are fast every time!! Great service! One of the bet sushi places on my side of town! :) yum!

The rolls that we received were delicious but the nigiri were a little on the small side. Biggest complaint of our dinner was when we asked for the "daily special" called stuffed tomato they said they were out of it. When we asked what they were out of they then said they weren't making this roll anymore tonight, and this was 45 minutes before closing. At this time we also noticed the sushi chefs putting the fish away and cleaning up their stations as well as the waitresses and hostess putting their jackets on and getting ready to leave. We were very uncomfortable and felt almost forced to leave even though they weren't closing yet. We enjoy sushi on a regular basis and there are closer places to our house, so we will not be going out of our way to go there again.

Great service!,Variety of rolls,fresh and tasty. Banana roll is definitely different but good. Mexican roll with a touch of Habanero is goodSpicy!!but gets your taste buds going. I enjoyed all food. All you can eat can't beat the deal.!!
Great sushi!! I love their sashimi plate! Very fresh and tasty fish and sauce. I'm sure this place is the best for Japanese cuision!! Nice service as well! Recommend!

This is my family and I's go-to sushi place!! Service is ok but the yummy sushi and bento boxes make up for it! The prices are a bit high for some of the specialty rolls but it's pretty typical everywhere else. I have done their ACYE once but definitely do it when you don't have your kids with you because they don't want you to share or take home any of it. So basically come hungry if you're doing ACYE so you can get your money's worth!

I used to recommend this place to all my friends...not anymore. Only one waitress for a busy Wed night and the 2nd waitress that was in "training" was not helpful...did not bring my friend miso soup (said "sorry, I'm training"..as she dropped off our sake). We later saw her deliver salad to the couple next to us. They used to have a Korean Lasagna and ?Volcano roll.  Not on the menu anymore...probably too much work or $$, but the sushi chefs that were there when it was a menu item, were there that night.  If you are a "repeat" customer. you should make an effort to retain that customer. They still have the "ingredients"...      It really is fresh sushi here... the blue fin tuna was so delicious!  The mgmt just needs to come help the lone waitress....

Love this place, service is always good no matter what time of day.  The all-you-can-eat is the best way to go! Make sure you ask for a Paul,  he's always look out for his customers and makes great recommendations.

Really great, fresh food. Generous servings. Reasonable prices. The all you can eat deal rocks. Best sushi I've had in a long time. Golden Dragon roll, DJs special, salmon teriyaki all fresh and really tasty. Sunomono the best. And desert - honey toast?  Genius. So simple. Ice cream on honey drizzled toasted bread. How could I have not thought of this?  Came away with a very happy tummy. Strip mall alert!  Don't let the location deter you.

Came in on a Friday night for a party of three people. We were seated pretty quickly and had drink orders taken. The menu here is quite diverse, which I find to be pretty important when having AYCE sushi. Their rolls aren't all some variation of California rolls either.   I took off one star because a few of the menu items are extremely limited, such as "one order per person"..and that's total. I've heard of one order per round, but not per person. Will this prevent me from coming back? No. The fish tasted fresh and the presentation was great. Customer service was good, but not the best...Though i've come to lower my expectations for customer service at sushi restaurants. Overall, good quality food.

Helpful tip: when you offer all you can eat for lunch, then we proceed to eat all we can eat, don't get a pissed off holier than thou attitude and then make snide comments about how much we are eating. We were one of two parties in the restaurant, so I guarantee your job wasn't that effing difficult while we were there. Horrible service, and horrible food. Sushi bomb is simply an explosion of attitude and disappointment.

Always loved how their food always tasted fresh...they have a new menu. They kept my favorite roll, DJ Special. I am hoping they did not change their standards and just expanded their menu. AYCE is still available...more reviews to come.

This is our regular sushi place. They have a great selection of sushi rolls as well as some unique twists (my favorite is the Crispy Banana - a tempura fried banana with spicy tuna). The service isn't always the fastest but for $27 it's hard to beat the AYCE dinner if you're hungry.

This is our favorite sushi place in town. The prices are reasonable and the environment is fresh and contemporary. The service is great. Our favorite roll is ode de toilet, careful though! its really spicy.

This all you can eat sushi place has pretty fresh fish and the sushi is not overwhelmed by a large amount of rice.  Tucked away in a strip mall a little north of Summerlin, the location is ideal but the parking is somewhat limited as it is located right next to a martial arts studio.  The fresh shrimp and sea urchin sushi are pretty good (which is the telltale sign of the freshness of the fish).  Great service.  Would definitely go there again.

This is not your typical grocery store bought California roll. This place is definitely on my sushi list. Of course they have ALLYOUCANEAT at $19.95!! I'd say what a steal! The reason why it's on my list is cus 1: they have my Cajun albacore and 2: they don't put too much rice in the rolls. Which means it's definitely quality taste. Best of all, the service is consistently efficient.   My favorite roll here is the warm springs roll. And don't forget to save room for their deep fried tempura ice cream. May I suggest trying it in plum flavor :)
Andy is amazing! He creates amazing masterpieces and always goes above n beyond for his customers! This place has top notch food n friendly staff. I love love love this place. Always my first choice.
My co worker and I go here often. Prices are reasonable! Good food and service!  Highly recommend it!! Lunch specials are awesome!!

Someone fire that Asian guy who runs the front of the house.  Terrible server who gets too comfortable with his customers.  Sushi bomb DOES NOT know how to handle big parties.   They purposely "forget" rolls.    It was an embarrassment bringing visitors here.  Do not come here.

I'm a regular customer at Sushi Bomb and have always had a good experience. I usually get the AYCE and have ordered the tempura udon several times and I have always gotten a full sizes bowl with a separate plate of tempura. However, this time I was given a small bowl with little noodles and the tempura thrown in. The coating fell off the vegetables and shrimp and into my soup :( I don't know what changed from my last visit, but, it did put a damper on my experience.

Only 1 visit but so far so good. I went on a Saturday night, family of four. We all had AYCE and for the most part we enjoyed every roll. My favorite was the Angry Dragon. Seafood was fresh, everything was well prepared and presented. Service would be the only black mark. It wasn't busy, but had it been I'd be concerned because there was only one waitress. AYCE was $21 each which is fine IMO. Will visit again soon.

For the price of $21, the all you can eat lunch sushi was pretty awesome. The portions of the nigiri are a bit smaller but it is an all you can eat!   Nothing crazy sets place apart but it is still good and worth while!
Not that happy with their bento and sushi. Took long for my order because they forgot my order and when I finally got my order the meat was tough.....I've had better

Ill give this place 5 stars. The food here is on point. Def hit up the all you can eat. I love sushi cause thats what i grew up on and Ive had some bomb sushi and this place def has some decent sushi. I have my all time favorite spot but being that this is closer to my place i usually go here haha The staff is friendly and fairly fast with the service. Its a very small place but if you dont mind the wait im sure you wont be disappointed. The all you can eat sushi is worth the price. If you were to do the ala cart, by the time youve ordered 3-4 different things youde already have paid the price for the all you can eat. It would be nice if they did have a bigger seating area as they do get busy. But lts worth the wait.

Got some take out from here the other night.  Pretty decent and made it last for two nights.  I know, I know, some people saw not to do that with sushi.  But so far I have never had a problem!  I feel like I am getting more for my money too ;)    I do agree that too many of the rolls are very Americanized.   Cream cheese here and cream sauce there.  Deep fried this crunchy that.  I like sashimi and vegetables in my rolls.   I ordered salmon sashimi and two rolls.  The sashimi was great-just like butter.  The spicy tuna was good-not too spicy thank goodness.  The Wild Wild west have cream cheese in it but I still found it to be quite tasty.   I probably be back, its right by my neighborhood market, but it won't be my regular place.
Great service, good nigiri, below average sushi. I wouldn't come back, nor recommend this restaurant. There are too many great places on Spring Mountain for me to ever come back.

I was visiting from California with some friends when we came across Sushi Bomb. The food was absolutely delicious and our waiter, John, was the best! He was very nice and attentive. He made us feel welcomed. Would definitely go back for the great food and customer service!

I'm a big fan of AYCE(all you can eat).  The sushi and sashimi was really fresh when I went.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Seating is a little crowded after 5pm but worth it.  Appetizers are creative and delish.  I'm in love with their buffalo shrimp tempura.  Yellow tail and salmon collar bone.  A Citrus sorbet.  Must try!    Eat greedy, yours truly -Mizz Loveli

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE EXPLAINED: I was in the area, so I tried Sushi Bomb for a second time (first time did not go well either) with friends and our kids.  Major disappointment. MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT! Their AYCE sushi was a little pricey but it was Sunday late afternoon, and we knew the AYCE dinner price was still a value. The kids meal also seemed like a good value. NOTE: Hot green tea was NOT included for $27.99 per AYCE adult sushi which seemed strange to me. We were told right away to order ALL of our sushi at once because they would NOT otherwise be able to make it without us waiting up to 25 minutes for each order... WHAT? That is NOT how "All You Can Eat" is supposed to work. We all felt cheated because of the time delay between our ordering and receiving our food. This needs to be fixed Sushi Bomb! Hire more sushi chefs and servers (there must have been around 75 people in this little restaurant and it looked like only THREE servers). THEN THEY GOT OUR ORDER WRONG, forgot items (I never did get my blue fin tuna nigiri), had to replace items with other choices (even though the fish we wanted was an advertised item on the table display), served us COLD HOT GREEN TEA (which took over 10 minutes to get replaced) they mistakenly put my last specialty roll on another table so I had to WAIT LONGER to get it after they tried to influence me to cancel the order (as we were at the end of our dinner)... The food quality was okay UNTIL THEY SERVED THE GOLDEN SCALLOPS, which WERE NOT EVEN SCALLOPS AT ALL!! The "Golden Scallops" were made with FAKE CRAB MEAT (they later admitted to us that it was fish cake, but I know what the imitation crab meat looks and tastes like), which were OVER-BREADED in a flavorless, over-fried very hard coating... YUCK!!! Gross!!! We asked for a discount as our check for this experience was almost $200 for 3 adults and 3 kids, and were only given ONLY $12 off... why that amount, I could not tell you, but we agreed that at least it was some amount taken off of the check.  I will NEVER RETURN to Sushi Bomb. I did not enjoy it. We finally paid and left, but this bad experience was not over yet...  After all of this, I unfortunately felt victimized by Sushi Bomb as they squeezed in SO MANY TABLES in that place that I could not walk through to the exit without knocking stuff off of one of their tables... which is HUMILIATING and MUST BE A FIRE HAZARD!!! (I wish I had taken pictures to post, but I did not... if so you could see the "Golden Scallops" horror... )

Just recently went there and got to explore the menu a little. These special rolls were conquered!  This Guy- *****- The soft shell crab combo is EXCELLENT! Stuffed Tomatoes- ***- A bit sloppy but the salmon was good. not too much flavor though. Sex on the Beach-****- nice spicy kick to it! S & H Special-*****- Most exotic roll I've tasted

As all you can eat sushi goes this place is great. Often the service is slower than it should be, but the food comes quickly once you order and is exactly what you'd expect. FYI - there is one roll that comes with a heat warning, both on the menu and a verbal from the staff. The warning was something we should Have heeded

While visiting Las Vegas. A great get away a hidden treasure for sure. If you are staying at red rock you are very close. The sushi was amazing some unique dishes that I have never seen before. I came away with a full belly and not an empty purse.

Best sushi place around my area, recently got a new menu with all kinds of good stuff.   They got rid of all you can drink though which was a huge disappointment as it was our #1 draw to go to this specific sushi joint. May have to find a new one with a similar deal if it does not return. If it was because it was too cheap, I would easily still do it for more!
One of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas! The sushi is such quality and the service is always excellent.

ALWAYS have such a great experience at Sushi Bomb. There aren't many sushi locations in this area and this one is top notch. I would come here even if I didn't live in the area! All of their fish is fresh and delicious. The customer service is amazing. I love when a 1HR AYCE place actually is attentive so you don't have to order everything at once because they will always be around to check up on you!
I've been to some sushi spots in town and I have to say this one is my favorite. This is my go to sushi spot, i love coming here.
Sushi bomb is my favorite!!!! The staff here is incredible. The happy hour here is awesome too! Check this place out.
My favorite sushi spot on the north side of Vegas!!! Service is great and quality is awesome!!! Can't go wrong with AYCE when the choices are so BOMB!!!
Best sushi spot in my area. Always get the ayce as it's the best value. Love the rainbow rolls and spicy tuna rolls. Waiters and waitresses are friendly. Great service

What happened Sushi Bomb? This used to be a great place years ago, but ever since new management took over, it has not been the same.   So, the waitress had no personality and looked pretty annoyed while taking our orders. She was seriously so SLOW. My boyfriend and I didn't even get offered any drinks or a menu until about 10-15 minutes after we sat down with my family.   Some of their specialty rolls like the Touchdown was good. Their eel sauce as part of the DJ's Special (one of my favorite rolls) seriously tasted like cinnamon was way too sweet for me. I was a little bummed.  Overall, they need to fix their customer service, timing and definitely try to be more attentive to their guests.

This is the best sushi spot in the North West Valley. Everything is always fresh. They do get busy, but they handle it well and make sure everyone is taken care of. My favorite is the spicy Tuna roll. The spicy edemame is the best too.   Must go!

This place used to be "the bomb", but I am not sure if ownership changed because primarily customer service is rude and the food kind of sucks. I used to almost on a weekly basis order a shrimp tempura roll and gladly pay the ten bux for that one roll because it was so satisfying. The last few times I have gone, stuff has tasted weird and I get the skinniest rolls with almost no topping on them. I am really bummed becasue it is right up the street from me, but I don't care to spend my money or time getting mediocre food and service. The chefs used to be so friendly and now they seem annoyed which really affects food quality

Sushi Bomb has a wide variety of specialty rolls that I have never heard of before!  We ordered AYCE for lunch, which was about $22 per person.  Our server warned us in advance that any leftovers would be charged at regular price...although this is a rule we are aware of, I've never been verbally told about it.    I'm pretty picky with sushi, but surprisingly I loved one roll that I would never have ordered on my own.  I believe it was called The Hulk, which contains soft shell crab and some sort of yummy sauce.  In the end- the food was tasty, we were stuffed and the service was good.

This place is fiyaaaaa. You haven't had bomb sushi until you've had sushi bomb, ya feel? Believe me fam, they lit like the Fourth of July. You can cash me ousside they door, how bow dah. YASSSSSS GAWD.
This is the worst sushi place. The food is ok but the staff is so lame. Can't even take the order right. They have to learn how to speak English and take orders correctly. They defenetly bombed out.

Best sushi! The fish is super fresh and high quality. AYCE is worth the price. $27 for dinner. Also good  menu selection for those who don't eat sushi. The bentos are delicious! Fun atmosphere. Always clean inside and the staff is really nice. Kyle is our favorite! Hands down one of the best places I've eaten at. Highly recommend it!

This place is delicious! We ordered AYCE and it was totally worth it. We ordered a ton of rolls, appetizers, soup, desserts -- sushi bomb roll, wild wild west, rainbow roll, tuna lovers, salmon cheese stick, gyoza, spicy garlic edamame, crispy rice with spicy tuna, blue fin tuna sashimi, beef udon, mochi, tempura banana split. All of it was delicious and the service was great! We will definitely go back.

Best sushi I have ever had in LV... but still have a few more places to try. We go here weekly.   You must try: Rabbit Pearl, X-girlfriend, Touchdown 2 & Rock N Roll   Always awesome sushi, service can be slow at times but most of the time it is on point and friendly. AYCE is a must and they have AYD (All you can drink beer) for cheap too.   Give it a shot!

I think I might have found my new favorite Sushi spot! It's a hidden Jem, It's small, but nicely decorated.   Now for the best part the sushi... So good! Our favorite roll was the Baked Salmon & the Shrimp Tempura Roll. The Salmon literally melts in your mouth and it's the best feeling ever. I love Shrimp so I had to get the Shrimp Tempura Roll and I wasn't disappointed I loved it.   I cannot wait to come back here again & try out some more rolls. Honestly the best and the tastiest place ever.

What can I say the place was amazing and the food was delicious. I forgot the guys name, but I know he was Vietnamese ( our server ) he was very fast getting our order and bringing us our food. We were a table of 11 and two baby and he took good care of us. We did all you can eat and by the end I was so happy and full! Definitely we all will come back again! Thanks to my lil brother now I know another great place to eat sushi !!!
Awesome! Loved their spicy edamame. And the rest of the sushi was super fresh

Me and my bf are sushi fanatics and LOVE to find new low key places. Came across this place on yelp and knew I had to check it out! So after class on a Thursday, around 10p, we decided to give this place a shot.  Located around at Cheyenne and 215. It was quiet when we arrived, only 2 other girls at the bar. There were 2 sushi chefs and a server on duty. Everyone was really nice. They recommended the S&H Roll and we also ordered the Kimono Roll. Both of which are cream cheese rolls so it's kinda heavy, but DELICIOUS!! Comes with a little salad with their dressing in the center. Just hit the spot.  Also tried their yellowtail roll and scallop sushi. Scallops were big but not too fresh (I usually only get them when I am in Cali) and the yellowtail was okay, not really a fan.  What I am a fan of is their dessert! They have plum flavored ice cream! (Photo added) we had plum tempura ice cream. YUM! There's chunks of plum in the ice cream.   Service was awesome, food was great, ambiance was nice, good location for me. Great place. Must check it out.  I plan to return regularly when I am not dieting :)

We've been customers of Sushi Bomb since day one - so I can't believe I haven't written a review!  This is our convenient go-to neighborhood sushi joint - perfect for after work noshing without having to drive too far. Although, like everything else in Vegas, it's in a suburban strip mall - the interior is well done - with wood paneled walls with large paintings of koi and paper lanterns hanging from the ceiling. The glass tiled wall behind the sushi bar gives it a bit of hip chic.  We've always felt the food is good here. Sure - the waitress will always make the obligatory joke when you ask for a "Kiss My Ass" roll - and like so many sushi bars in town, everything has a somewhat dirty name. I have to admit, I don't find this trend particularly appealing, but whatev.  Last night the two of us split the aforementioned Kiss My Ass, the Red Tiger roll, Veggie Roll, and garlic tuna nigiri chased down with a house saki and a large Kirin. A new roll for us, The Red Tiger, is shrimp tempura and avocado wrapped in spicy tuna with a garlic sauce which is amazing. A new favorite. We don't do the AYCE because it isn't worth it for us - we can't eat that much!   Service was peppy and good as usual. Sometimes they can get a little spacey during a rush - but it's a cute spacey.

We came to Sushi Bomb at 2:30 pm for AYCE, not knowing that lunch pricing cuts off at 3:00pm. Luckily the server was very accommodating and allowed us to pay the lunch price, as long as we finished putting in our order by the cut-off.   There is a great selection of AYCE menu items including appetizers, entrees, and desserts. It's $21 for AYCE lunch and $27 for dinner (kids are cheaper), and you will definitely get your money's worth.   As far as sushi quality goes, everything was good. The unagi, ahi, hamachi and smoked salmon nigiri were delicious. Rolls are big and if you're placing your last order they allow half orders. We tried the 007, Snow Rabbit, White House, and the DJ.   All of that sushi plus side orders of chicken karaage, ika tempura, gyoza, and zaru soba left my boyfriend and I very VERY full.   Service was prompt and our server was helpful and polite. Sushi Bomb is a great option for sushi in our neighborhood.

This is one of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. Thanks to their all you can eat special I was able to try out several different rolls and enjoyed them all. I was also impressed by how fast the service was since the place was a bit busy at the time. I would definitely recommend going here if you are in the mood for sushi.

I'm not really a sushi fan, but everyone I know is. That being said, everyone I've brought here loves it! I always get the shrimp tempura, and the Yagozi dumplings (fried, not steamed), and finish it with their mochi ice cream. But the thing I CRAVE from here is their strawberry Nigori, it's so sweet it's like a sake milk shake.

Very good quality sushi! I came here at 11pm on a Friday night.  The uni, hamachi and red snapper were all fresh. They had kanpachi on the menu but they ran out, unfortunately. The appetizer list was a bit short but good quality.    The only thing that I didn't like was that they added too much rice on the nigiri.

Still loving this freakin place.  Honestly when you really take a look at the reviews- the only reason it doesn't have a better overall rating is because of the service.  The sushi is SO good though!  The spicy garlic edamame, the S & H special, their sashimi... just amazing.  And really.. the service has never been a problem for me.  Really, give this place a try. :)

I have lived in the neighborhood by Sushi Bomb for 3 years and I'm so mad at myself that I've just now gone for the first time! It is incredible. We had the coconut lovers roll and the original sushi bomb roll. Both were to die for! Can't wait to go back!

Sushi Bomb!!!   My husband took me here a year ago for the 1st time.  It is not close to our home, but VERY worth the drive.  We have visited a few sushi bars here in Vegas, and By Far, Sushi Bomb is the BOMB!  I love the all you can eat, they offer new suggestions and the quality is superb!  The staff is attentive, and very friendly! We have gone to Sushi Bomb a few times and they will always be our 1st choice for a great Japanese meal!  Yummi....I may just go again this weekend!
Come here if you want the following:   1. FORGET YOUR ORDERS  2. FORGET  REFILLS 3. DIRTYNESS  4. RUDENESS

First time to visit from out of town  The moment we walked in restaurant did not feel very welcoming . Waitress seem rushed so it made our lunch very rushed and not enjoyable . I usually like to walk into restaurant to enjoy my meal with my company and have a pleasant lunch .  Was not very pleasant nor comfortable . My expectation ordering a hot miso soup  is to have it served hot.   Hot water I ordered was like warm  Not very pleased with this restaurant and will not recommend to business partners, friends or relatives to pick this place as a first choice. Would think twice before I ever come to this place

This place was da bomb. Wife and I came here to eat and watch the golden knights play. The ayce is great cause after a couple rolls it pays for itself. Also comes with a dessert loved the fried banana split. Definitely will be back. Hint if coming for dinner get there early it fills up quick.
Best sushi in Las Vegas! Great AYCE deal, fresh ingredients, awesome decor, friendly staff. LOVE everything about this place. I would give it 10 stars if possible. I am now a loyal Sushi Bomber!
Try the sushi bomb angry dragon. Delicious! $21 for unlimited sushi. The place is clean and the service is good.

Good selection with the rolls and price is competitively good. Great service from the staff especially John, he is on top of it and making our experience very enjoyable. Will definitely be back for more.
Sushi was OK but the service was terrible. Me and my group were rushed to order, hostess was extremely rude, and had to wait 10 minutes before we even got our service. Not worth the price.

Great food, fabulous service!  So much to choose from. Even for the non-fish eater like me!  We had 6 of us for dinner last night and everyone loved it!  Don't forget to check in on yelp for a free saki or beer!

This is my favorite all you can eat sushi spot. The food is always consistent, unlike other places that are not always fresh. They also have unique rolls that other spots don't have. Unfortunately, I live in Henderson and it's on the opposite side of town.

Was craving sushi today and to my surprise this place was right around the corner from. It's a nice place, very nice atmosphere and vibe. I sat at the bar, food was made quick and was very good. I had their "Red Rock chief special roll", two of them.

I ordered take out and got the Japanese lasagna roll. It was pretty good, but not memorable. I also got the crab miso soup and it had a lot of crab meat in it which I can appreciate. Some places just don't add a lot of seafood to their dishes.   Ordering take out for sushi is always hit or miss and I'm a firm believer in sitting in the restaurant to eat Japanese. Nonetheless, I'll be going back some time real soon

Pork Belly. You can order it from the AYCE menu and it is phenomenal. Yes, this is a sushi place and the sushi selection is terrific. However, the reason I rank Sushi Bomb ahead of the AYCE competition is the menu beyond the raw fish. Grilled Salmon collar, bacon wrapped scallop yakitori and the buttery corn dish come to mind. For desert I always go with the honey toast. Tucked away off Cheyenne, a bit north of Summerlin, Sushi Bomb is a bit of a hidden gem, yet it is well worth the journey for us Vegas Sushi lovers.
This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas! I used to go here twice a week when I lived on that side of town! Delicious, quality sushi & some really unique house rolls. Nice atmosphere too.
We've never had a bad experience here. Prompt service and food. Great staff and the sushi chefs aretop notch. Tonight, everything was extremely fresh, well prepared, and tasty.
Pretty good. Had better, but good enough and I like the idea of the all-you-can-eat. My 2 year old actually liked the food and she doesn't eat anything! Recommended.

Food here is good. Large pieces of fresh fish on the nigiri.  The rolls are good, maybe not as creative as some other places in town.  The big let down was the slow and poor service.  I would give the sushi 4 - 4.5 stars and the service 2-3

Sushi is really good but service is very bad!!  I was waiting to get something to go and no one noticed me for like 10 minutes until they took my order. They are all over the place..didn't make me feel comfortable

Ugh, WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?!  Me and a girlfriend would always come here for good sushi when Sushi Kaya down in Chinatown started to fall off (they've recovered) and Sushi Bomb was always so good! Something happened recently where they took a lot of the rolls I loved, off the menu. We would always go inside and eat for lunch or dinner. It was a hit or miss. The food was always on point which is great, but the service in there was always horrid. Sometimes we'd wait 15 minutes before our waters were refilled in a restaurant of only 3 small filled tables. Unacceptable  There was even a day when every single table was not bussed of the previous diner's dishes that we had no choice but to sit at the bar and then new customers wouldn't have anywhere to sit! It was gross being surrounded by plates and half eaten food.   So, I started getting it to go. The food was still good I just didn't want to deal with the in house situation. Well they've managed to disappoint me there too. It's always hard to order take out when the restaurant doesn't have a website or a current menu posted anywhere online. I always a specific roll and the past three times they've forgotten the sauce that goes on top. Last time they also forgot the ginger and wasabi. (which I actually use)   NOW, all that being said, I somehow still recommend it. They've expanded their menu a bit and have a lot of options besides just sushi. Good to take kids to, people that don't like raw fish, and good for groups. Maybe it's just the time I go, but it looks look a couple staff members may have changed. BUT if you do take out, I'd recommend that you tell them to keep your food in a fridge because they will leave it right at the register if you show up 15, 20, or 30 minutes after it's prepared. Raw fish+room temp= a big no no.

I have eaten at many AYCE sushi stops here in the Las Vegas metro, and I can say unequivocally that Sushi Bomb may be my new favorite, it's on the fast track.  Prices are compatible to others, and I feel the decor, speed and most importantly-the fresh taste of the fish make this one of the best values at the price point. I like that they offer a kids AYCE menu AND a separate kids entree menu so my four year old can find something she wants. One part of AYCE is that a lot of places, the rolls begin to taste very similar unless you stretch to the far corners of the menu.  Not do at Sushi Bomb, each roll had its own distinct flavor that did not disappoint.   I recommend the namesake roll, the Sushi Bomb as well as the White House roll.  My wife is a fan of the Coconut Lover. The service was quick and friendly. I will be back, I look forward to it
BEST Sushi I have had in a VERY long time!!! Love the atmosphere as well. I would highly recommend going here :)
Sushi bomb is the bomb place for sushi!! AYCE definitely recommended! Sashimi is very fresh!

Big fan of sushi... When we decided to go here for ayce I had never heard of it.  We sat at the sushi bar and the chef gave us a piece of nigiri each... Good not great as tasted a little fishy. Then we shared a few rolls... The hulk, rabbit pearl and who love long time were really good (big fan spicy tuna or spicy rolls in general). He got the Mexican lasagna... It was good but I'm not a yum yum fan but he really liked it!  For $20 you are better off doing ayce than buying even two rolls for lunch! And sharing is perfect as get to taste more variety!  The service varied, she kept our glasses full and was good about bringing more ginger as we both really like it. The chef however seemed a little slow as 20 min later we had everything but one roll and he was kind of snippy saying its coming when we asked. But it was enjoyable And I would go back, especially to share sushi! Thanks for showing me a new place!

Well, I USED to be obsessed with this place. I didn't come in for about a month and on my recent visit, everything was different. The menu changed and they took off a lot of my favorite rolls. Didn't seem like there were as many options as before.   The saddest part of my visit was that they no longer have the all you can drink draft beer as an add on for all you can eat.  To be honest that's one of the main reasons we would all come here, because who wants to pay $7 for ONE beer when you can pay $4.99 for all you can drink draft Sapporo?! Nobody, that's who!   Needless to say, I probably won't be frequenting this location anymore. There's plenty of other good sushi restaurants with cheaper AYCE and alcohol specials. Yes they're farther from my house but this place has lost its luster. If it was still the awesome Sushi Bomb I knew and loved, we would still all be going there!

My significant other and I eat here at least once a month. We are both pretty picky about our sushi and love Sushi Bomb. We have eaten AYCE and a la carte and have always been happy. You can't beat all the yummy stuff that you can eat with their AYCE though, which is pretty much their full menu. Some of our favorites are the Coconut Lover roll, the pork belly, the green muscles and their Nigiri is always good. Their specials they have are always great and change often to always give you something new to try. You also get $3 Sapporo beers when you eat AYCE, can't beat that!

20% off happy hour Monday through Thursday hooked me, because it is 9pm to midnight on all food. This place is fairly new and a hidden gem in the Wal-Mart Grocery shopping center (next to Lee's Liquor). I love the Yellowtail Jalapeno Sashimi and my fiance loves all the sake offerings on the menu. Service is great and speedy. A great local spot on this side of town that was needed. Enjoy.
