Ok so before I go on with this review, I need to tell you first that I am not too much into sushi except for your basic California rolls. With that said, what I always wanted to do was try ALL types of sushi. My reasoning is that why try different types and pay for each roll. What if I dont like that roll? So the best answer was to do an all you can eat! Pay one price and try everything! Well everything that you can eat anyway. I heard if you have leftovers they charge you. So my plan was to go with friends and team up!  So, this place has a buy 2 all you can eat, get one free! Split the bill three ways and you're set! They have this special I think starting at 9 pm. Call them for more details.  Now for the food. OMG! First of all, I didnt know there were lots of different sushi combinations and they all have different names. For this place you got sexual inuendos as names. How fitting for a sushi virgin. Names like sex on the beach, ex boyfriend/girlfriend, and 69 are just some of the options. Hay, im not making this up! I tried a lot of different rolls my friends ordered. Of course we were not able to order everything.   Service was good. I didnt have any thing out of the ordinary to complain about. We got what we ordered in a timely manner. Refills were constant. Our server answered all my questions quickly and even had some suggestions.   Everything I tried seemed really good. I didnt even bother trying to read what each individual roll consisted of. With the help of my friends, all the selections were really good. I think the next time I will be more assertive in picking my own rolls. For now, this experience was well worth it and I can take it off my bucket list.  So if you have any favorites or suggestions for me, (heck, even a recommendation for another sushi place is welcome so I can compare is fine with me) feel free to send me a message! Im still trying to get the hang of eating sushi! Thanks Sushi Bomb for being gentle!

This place changed my thinking on AYCE! Their menu is pretty open for the AYC eater and service is pretty fast even when the place is packed. The sushi was pretty fresh and the rice was not dry. From appetizers, soups, salads, sushi, sashimi, rolls, noodles, skewers, it was totally available and they didn't hold back. They even have a AYCE price on their draft Sapporo, $3! With a price tag of $27 per adult AYCE, you cant beat it!

One word... YUMMY! Awesomely unique rolls and super fresh sushi. The price? Comparable to other sushi restaurants. Highly recommend the S&H Special!  One tip: if ordering hot sake, ask them to heat it up more a bit. It's usually served more on the tepid side.
My favorite restaurant ever! I'm from North Carolina and I visit Vegas a few times out of the year, Sushi Bomb is always a MUST when I come. All-you-can-eat is where it's at! EVERYTHING is delicious!
Food Amazing  Service Great  But Paul Makes you feel at home!!!   Must try the Tonight roll and the LA BBQ ribs

Best avocado rolls in town. Not a pound of rice like other places. Avocados always looking fresh. No browning here.  I give it four stars because the service is soooooo slow.  There were only 3 tables besides ours so I couldn't see the reason for the slow speed.  The food is good enough and prices are reasonable so it's worth it.

If it wasn't for Paul and Jennifer I would honestly not come here! The food is delicious and this is by far my favorite ayce place! Although I almost stopped coming here cause the people were so rude to my family one time I came! But ever since I met Paul I continue to come only when he is here! He is the best server in this place and his partner Jennifer was amazing as well! Thanks Paul and Jennifer  for your great service I look forward to our next visit!!

We had our hesitations about Sushi Bomb because of some of the 1 star reviews, and because we have our usual go-to sushi spots around Vegas that never disappoint. We moved to the NW side of town recently, and decided to give Sushi Bomb a try due to its proximity to our home-- and we couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised! The fish was not only fresh, but it's one of the few places in town that offer super white (my fave!) Our waiter was super friendly, and very helpful with the menu. He offered his opinion on some of their popular rolls, all of which were amazing. Even the dessert menu was unique and offered different options than what we are used to (I went for the deep friend banana split- DELICIOUS!) Great spot, great service, great experience. We will be returning!
Love the sushi and service. The only negative thing is: their hot tea it's a little too weak for my taste.
I have introduced many people to Sushi Bomb and all leave saying the same thing. 'That was some of the best sushi I have had in awhile!' I go as often as I can. Fabulous!!
Great and yummy place to eat out with my kids!!!!  They love shirmp tempura and udon.  Good service and good food. great neighborhood eat out place!

Great all you can eat special.. Enjoyed a great lunch with my honey! The tiger roll and the late night roll (pretty sure that is the name)are awesome..sushi bomb is soooo bomb!!!! The Staff was very friendly and accommodating..we will be back soon!

Are you looking to gain unwanted pounds and WASTING your calories?  Are you DYING to be served by a nonchalant waitress who only fills up your drinks when you ask her to, plus bonus attitude?  Then you are in luck! Sushi Bomb is the place for you! Call NOW and secure a spot for your All You Can Eat RICE at only $19.95 for lunch.  That's right! You can have all the rice you want in your nigiri and rolls for only $19.95.  But WAIT! If you call in the next 10 minutes, they will even include unrecognizable soft shell crab all mushed up in your sushi rolls! What a deal!   That is all.

Based on reviews from fellow yelpers, I wanted to find a different place to eat sushi for evening other than my usual sushi bar.  Since this place is somewhat near our house, we stopped in for an early dinner.  The bar area is quite nice, overall decor very comforting and natural.  I loved the fact that the place was basically all ours for the hour we were there.  The menu is great--simple and with some great options done differently.  Their amaebi, for example, includes the deep fried fish heads along with the two pieces of sushi.  I personally love sucking on a few shrimp heads, because that's where all the flavor is.  It was great.  We ordered all the yakitori skewers, 4 types, and it came with 2 skewers each.  Thinking they were the small yakitori, we didn't think it would be a lot to order for dinner. Oh my.  These skewers are pretty big, so majority of our dinner were the appetizers.  It was great!  The sauce was yummy and the meats were cooked well.  As for the shrimp ones, I didn't eat the shrimp.  I feel that shrimp should ALWAYS be cleaned because that black line is poop, and I don't eat poop.  That was a no-no for me, and therefore a deduction of 1 star on my review.  As for the rest, we tried their sushi, all perfectly portioned and the fish was great.  Their sauces are very good at this restaurant, everything from their cucumber salad, tempura dip, to the sauce they put on their yellowtail.  Oh and their tempura is crispy and light, too.  We loved it.  I think this place, despite its location being right next to the 215 on W. Cheyenne, is a really good sushi bar.  We plan to go back this week to try the rest of the menu.  If you want a road trip within city limits, try this place.  I know that they serve the same special rolls as any other sushi bar, but their sauces and talent make for a great night.  Plus their website says that it's 20% off after 9pm to midnight.    Great sushi, excellent service, and I'll definitely be back for more.

I would say that my family and I have frequented this establishment quite often over the past three years of living in Las Vegas. Anytime someone asks where we like to eat sushi, we always say here. We have had nothing but great service time and time again, until tonight. We wanted a seat for three, wait time was told 20-30 minutes- which was fine. They were busy, but we were first in line for a table. About 10 minutes later a woman and her child came in requesting specifically to sit at the bar because a table was going to take too long. Watching one couple finish their desert we knew our time was coming! (Yay!- right?!) waitress sat the woman and her child at our table. I asked and all I got was an "I'm so sorry" nothing. Nothing. Waited a few more minutes before deciding to get with two other strangers and share the six top that had been empty long before we walked in.   Once seated we ordered drinks and our first round of food. Everything was great until after we noticed our second round of plates were empty and we had nothing left to eat. 45 minutes later we finally received our plate of nigiri and last roll. Not once during our meal were we asked if we would like to order, if we needed more drinks or how everything was. I ended up talking them into only charging me for two all you can eat and one single roll since my sister ordered the one roll that took over an hour to make and didn't eat anything else nor did she want to order more after sitting at the table watching us eat for an hour.   $87 later and I'll be honest, I didn't leave a tip. This truly breaks my heart to have had this experience at our (previously) favorite sushi restaurant.   I've worked in the food industry before, and I think a little communication and organization such as sections for a specific server so they're not all tending to every table would do a long way.   Love,  Broke and still hungry.

The name speaks for itself. Been here twice and each time was great food and attentive service. We did the all you can eat which at some places can be more rice than anything, but this place rocks it with a ton of fish and the quality is amazing. We will be back again and again!
Love this place, ate their it's perfect. I eat to go a lot and it's also always the best to go ever. So neat, and very nice people.

Man this place used to be real good, the fish was fresh and the prices where reasonable.  Then the unthinkable happened, AYCE, NOOOOOO.  Well I wasn't in the mood gorge myself with rainbow rolls and I wanted to leave but Silvio wouldn't let me because we already sat down :)  So i ordered ala cart and my worst fear became a reality, the quality of the fish plummeted, the salmon nigiri tasted like albertsons salmon and the tuna was, well, ok I guess.    If they had the same quality fish as before and still had AYCE it would have been a frigging gold mine, but I digress, it is not.  I like sushi mon and this place seems comparable quality wise albeit 4 bucks more since to get the signature rolls there is an up-charge and not sure if you can order hot stuff off the menu with ayce.  The ala cart menu was reasonably priced however.

Came here for my wife's birthday. Had the AYCE Sushi. It was a Tuesday night, around 6pm. Wasn't too busy, there were open tables, but we chose to sit at the sushi bar. We each had three rolls. I had a Dragon Roll, LA BBQ Roll, and a specialty spicy tuna roll (I have forgotten the name.) All the rolls were very good and fresh. The AYCE wasn't too bad $27, and they had a lot of things that we didn't have room to try.   The staff are very attentive, we had multiple people willing to put our order in, checking on our drinks, and making suggestions on what we may like. I would recommend checking this place out if you're in the area. Only gave 4 stars because it didn't blow me away, but it was definitely a very good place to visit.

I will NEVER bring my business here again- It was just me eating, unfortunately I !SOON! started to not feeling good in between rolls and had to excuse myself from the bar and immediately used the restroom- they charged me the all you can eat- plus a 10$ fee for not finishing my 1 roll-  even though I told them I felt ill - fuck y'all! Hope your business fails you no sympathy having, money grabbing, Jerks!!

This place gets three stars for a great selection and an extra fourth for there AYCE&D.  They have a pretty good selection of rolls, always important to me.  A few issues: Not a fan of the 'orgasm sauce' they use there. It came on the rock n roll and the stuffed tomato (which everywhere I've had this they do not sauce this roll) There imitation crab tastes funny (maybe it was just me)  I really really enjoyed the angry dragon roll, perfect perfect sweet and spicy blend!  The bf had his usual chicken teriyaki and Sapporo which he said was very satisfying and well worth the price paid.  The rolls were not overly rice-y like some AYCE places; there was plenty of fish.   Overall the food was good and the service was decent. The price is great.
nothing special. sushi not super fresh. fried chicken was dry and bland. udon was decent. better than the other items, but about par to other japanese restaurants

We moved to Vegas 5 months ago and have been trying every local place! We finally found a keeper! great service, bizarre for a sushi place. Garlic edamame was fantastic. Hulk roll and spicy tuna roll very good. Sushi Bomb roll is good if you like cream cheese.

Called to order food... woman could literally care less that I didn't know what to order. The website was no help either just titles with no specifics... they use to have great customer service but now that they have plenty of customers the customer service is out the window! We need a new sushi roll in the 89129 area.
Great sushi!  I highly recommend the Golden Dragon.  The Mexican Lasagna is also a great baked sushi.

Food is good however the "AYCE RULES " change from visit to visit and depending on your server the level of service will vary.  Honestly this is the two things that will drive my business away from this spot. Customer service is by far not one of their staffs strong suits.

Sushi Bomb has a great all you can eat lunch. Large selection. Everything we tried was perfectly prepared. They also have the non seafood lovers covered. Excellent panko crusted chicken. Service was timely and helpful.

This is one of our new favorite sushi places in town.  All of the rolls we have had are delicious and the staff is always very friendly.  It is not the cheapest AYCE, but it is still very reasonable and worth the money.  They also had a great deal when we were there that for $4 extra on the AYCE it included all you can drink draft beer which worked out great to wash down all the tasty/spicy rolls :)

Our first experience with Las Vegas' ayce sushi. I've seen some people talk about the quality of fish here, claiming that it's not fresh, or "what can you expect, it's not on the coast?" I haven't been to the coast yet,(hoping to soon) but it's really not THAT friggin' far. Any ways, I found the fish to be very fresh. The chefs used good cuts, and really seemed to know what they were doing. They had a lot of rolls that I haven't seen before, so I loved trying those out. The lasagna roll, I think it's called, was amazing. So was pretty much everything else I ordered. It definitely beats everything we had back in Atlanta. :)

This is a great little sushi place, tucked in the mountains on the NW.  The variety of rolls and tempura was awesome and the staff were friendly. It was quite crowded, even on a Wednesday evening, because it is a small restaurant. But we opted to sit at the bar. Nice selection of saki, too. We chose the all you can eat but honestly, I could barely put down two rolls so it would've been more cost effective if I did a la carte. I would definitely recommend this place but I personally wouldn't go on a Friday or Saturday because of how busy it was even mid-week. If you like spicier rolls, go for the Red Rock. It was delicious but had some kick.

I go here every so often with my family. As a hardcore avocado roll fan, the quality of the avocado really matters and Sushi Bomb never fails with their avocado roll quality. The food is great. The ambience is amazing. The decorations on the walls are very nice as well. Not to mention how amazing the prices are. I also love their miso soup!  My only complaint is that every few visits, service is slow. It takes a while to be seated and there isn't always a host/hostess at the table (even if there are tons of visible empty tables). They don't seem to have too many people working there, but thankfully, I've never had to wait more than 5~10 minutes--it just seems like a long time when you see the empty tables and you are very hungry!  I definitely would keep coming here whenever I'm in the area. I recommend Sushi Bomb to anyone who appreciates quality food.

If you are looking for a place to get sushi you should definitely go here! They have a wide variety of sushi to choose from and they are super quick with their service. Their fish always has tasted fresh and I would definitely recommend their no rice rolls as they are amazing!
Went for dinner and food was very good! Definitely worth getting all you can eat to taste all the different rolls they have to offer. My husband also ordered the honey toast, which was amazing!

When you walk in the music is bumpin. Sometimes you will get club like music and sometimes you will get Japanese music. I don't know when they play which. The waitress, Song, is awesome. If you get her then you will have a great time.  Everything I have ever eaten here has been fresh and has been really tasty. In fact, this is my FAVORITE sushi place. I would say it is about the same price as most sushi places.  Rolls i recommend:  Rabbit Pearl Love affair S&H Special

This is my goto sushi spot! I come probably 3 times a month and if i could, id come more :) i love the variety and the consistancy here. I loveeee the daily specials that are available everyday too! If you like great quality sushi for the ayce price, Bomb is the way to go!!!

We've been coming here for years. We've always had very prompt and friendly service. It does occasionally get a little backed up but on average they are almost always faster than the other AYCE places I've been to. The food is always excellent as well. Will continue eating here and recommending it to others.

I absolutely love this place, there's another sushi spot a little closer to my work but i will make the drive to come here. The have really good lunch specials including their bento box which comes with your choice of two main dishes and side yummy. The guys are super nice and don't laugh at you when you can't pronounce something, the decor is very clean and updated. Going to a sushi restaurant I'm always looking around making sure it's clean and a little cold, we don't need to get sick. the price's are pretty average and the sushi tastes fresh. If your in the area defiantly check it out you wont be disappointed.

Not sure how this place has positive reviews after my experience. Ordered Sushi Bomb via Postmates the other evening. We ordered a few rolls and a couple appetizers. Food came quick with no issue. We all commented on how good it looked and even enjoyed eating it...  Then the bomb came.... at about 3AM I woke up with horrible cramps. After literally crawling to the bathroom I spent the next hour or so (it felt like a lifetime) with it "firing out of both ends" and I do mean firing. It was horrible -- I may have to move.  After cleaning up I went to the kitchen to get some water and found my oldest in the main bathroom also extremely sick. I've never been so sick from food in my life. Never again.

The food is absolutely amazing. You get an insane variety of rolls, appetizers, and entrees to choose from for the "all you can eat".   Service is sub-par but for the food I can look passed it.   Try the Coconut Lovers Roll!!

I had to grab a quick lunch and there were only a few options near where I was working that day, so I ended up at Sushi Bomb. The interior was not too big, but it wasn't that busy for a weekday lunch (just a few other dining patrons).  Service was friendly and prompt, and my water were refilled consistently. I ended up ordering a roll, an appetizer, and a miso soup, but realized that my items' cost added up already exceeded the all-you-can-eat (AYCE) price (~$21+tax). Thus, I decided to switch to the AYCE dining option, which includes most of the menu (except some that are excluded, some that are dinner-only, and some that you can only order once).  I was very satisfied with the value once I chose AYCE, as I was able to add several other items to my meal. To the restaurant's credit, food preparation and service was very fast, such that I was able to have a full AYCE meal in just 30 minutes (I originally did not plan to order AYCE since I had such limited time). FYI, the time limit for AYCE lunch is usually 50 minutes.  This location is a bit far from home, but if I'm ever in the area, I would consider returning for their AYCE specials! See my photos for details about what I ate.  P.S. This place is Korean-owned with Korean employees and even occasional Korean pop music playing, but no one said this was an authentic Japanese restaurant. I still enjoyed my meal here and would recommend this place.

A little more expensive than most AYCE restaurants in Vegas (only by a few dollars) but very good and fresh sushi. If you're a tuna lover I highly recommend the Blue Fin tuna sushi they only allow one order per person.

Ordered two all you can eat sushi dinners, and ordered just a roll that wasn't on the menu. It was a salmon & cream cheese roll and the hostess/waitress said it would be an extra $1 for that??? If they want repeat business, they really shouldn't nickel and dime their customers! Very disappointed because the sushi was decent, but won't be back!
Best kids meal ever! Salmon, veggie tempura, rice, miso soup, orange... all for only $8 and delicious. Great service. We'll be back!

Terrible!! Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Rolls are trash and the hand roll selection blows as well. Avoid this place unless you like peeing out your butt. Step your game up Sushi Bomb. 7-11 sushi is honestly better. Disgrace
Service was amazing and the sushi was excellent! I was seated immediately upon arrival and was able to order just as quick. I would definitely recommend to anyone I know.
The few times me my wife and son have been in here we have all enjoyed ourselves.  Try the screaming orgasm.

Nigiri was good, but too much rice and rice was sweet!? Croquettes, Oysters, Agedashi Tofu, and Salmon Skin Salad were tasty... no half rolls until your last order!? failed on the ahi poke, rolls were OK... they were out of 3 of the 3 desserts offered on the menu. Overall, just A-OK.....ALOHA!!!

Sushi bomb is the best sushi place in the west side of vegas in my opinion.   This place has the option of either doing AYCE(all you can eat) or a la carte. I liked that when I went here last, some of our family members got to do a la carte instead of forcing the whole table to do AYCE.   The salmon nigiri is perfectly marbled and fresh it just melts in my stomach. They let you order half rolls which is just enough for tasting everything on the menu.   Highly recommended for those who live on the west side of vegas (this is on Cheyenne and 215) if you're too lazy or tired to drive all the way to the south side, strip, or Chinatown for some good sushi.

This is probably one of my top two favorite sushi spots in Vegas and I am a bit picky. Every roll that I have tried I have loved for all you can eat, and its not usually extremely packed which I really like because the service is great also. I cant wait to go back and would will probably recommend to anyone who wants some good sushi.
Bento box was pretty good. I wish it didn't have pork in it though . I had the salmon and  tempura . And I got a free saki when I checked in on yelp!#cherrybomb #saki #bentobox

Not a fan. We had a party of seven with four doing all you can eat and three eating a la carte. One of the a la carte guests ordered sea bass which apparently is supposed to be larger than the all you can eat portion. When it was brought to the table he proceeded to eat it and then was promptly told he wasn't allowed to eat it because he wasn't doing all you can eat so when he told the server that he did order it she said "Well it's supposed to be larger than that" and then the server told the rest of the table that we would have to eat it. Why should we have to eat someone else's half eaten sea bass when the server was the one that put in the wrong order? She literally wouldn't let him eat the smaller portion and made him wait until his new order arrived. What kind of place does that? Another guest ordered a roll without cream cheese and when it came with cream cheese the server didn't apologize. Even if it was the sushi chefs fault the server should normally apologize on the chefs behalf with a simple "Oh sorry about that." All in all the food was alright, nothing special. The wait after ordering was terribly long. There are so many other options for sushi in this town I would look elsewhere for your dining needs.

Great all you can eat sushi! Was even hesitant to go because every time we do all you can eat my husband complains and doesn't like the quality of the sushi but we walked out of here and he said it was really good and we will be back! A few of our favorites were the bluefin tuna, jalapeño yellowtail , and whatever roll had double tuna on it, oh and I love that they had fresh wasabi! Yum !

I wish there was a 0 stars!!! Got here 1 hour before closing and still got horrible service some food never got to the table and we were hurried to finish our food because they had to leave???!!!!! I work I. The industry and this is horrible customer service!!!! Dessert was out oft he question since it's 950 pm and they close at ppm, huh???? Will never cone back here

Went there for the first time for my granddaughters graduation with 10 of us, not a very big place inside, but I must say it was great service was great, food was awesome, and the staff was so nice having so many of us to deal withThe price was very reasonable too! I definitely will go back!

The staff customized my ramen the way I like it, even though it's not the menu. This is my go to Asian restaurant as there is not much up in the northwest. I recommend the orange blossom roll and my boyfriend always gets the chicken teriyaki.

So in a search to find another good sushi place preferably in the NW my wife and I stopped in here.   The service here was very good even when they are packed...the rolls were fresh and cold. We have been back several times to keep our sushi rotation fresh.  If you come during rush hours be ready for it to be packed, as it is with most small places these days.

I really, really like this sushi restaurant! I usually don't go for the rolls but I eat a lot of nigiri. So when I got to this place, surprisingly ate a lot of nigiri (of course), but also had my fair share of rolls. Their price is a tad bit higher but it's well worth what they're giving out. The staff was friendly and attentive. It's a long drive but I like to go during special occasions.
GREAT sushi!!  The fish is very fresh.  Very Clean.  Good Service!  Great Prices!!  Open Late.  LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Good sushi, I will give them that but god forbid you come in and one of the sushi chef's family comes in to eat, their service all of a sudden suck! We ordered salmon Kama first because it takes a long time to cook but they gave our food to the chef's family and told us 30 mins after that the kitchen did not get our order!  They need to improve their priorities in service. I get it, they are VIP but don't lie about our order!
Very good sushi! Red Rock and Sushi Bomb are my favorite rolls. The service is very quick and efficient. Rolls are fresh and nicely made.

this place is pretty bomb. =) they have a lot of specialty rolls that i've never seen before. the all you can eat special is definitely worth it...$19.95 for lunch, $26.95 for dinner. its a bit pricey for dinner if you don't have the appetite for all you can eat. we ordered the Sunny D, warm spring, this guy, and another roll that was listed in the gray box on the menu (we ordered the first two). all of the rolls were SUPER yummy! the tempura ice cream was also super tasty, share it with your friends because getting just a taste is good enough. service was good but a bit slow. i want to go back already! =)

This place is bomb! Just like its name! The service was great, the food was amazing.  I got the AYCE and got the bacon roll(who doesn't love bacon), the tonight roll, sushi bomb, and the angry dragon roll.  All were amazing! I'll definitely be frequenting this place and I suggest you all do the same!

Go hungry and leave full! Really good quality of fish and artistic rolls. They have a baja habernera  roll that surpassed my expectations. They are Korean owned operated Japanese sushi house. They have Japanese art decor but played Korean music. Good sushi

If the food wasn't so damn good here, then we would never come back. We sat for 27 minutes before someone even came over to get our drink order. A table came in after us got their food before we got our drink order.  We waited additional 25 minutes for them to take our food order. The food comes out pretty quick and it's absolutely phenomenal. We've been here for several times and the service is always slow. It appears that they're severely understaffed.  The sushi itself is extremely fresh, edamame delicious, teriyaki chicken bowl amazing, you cannot go wrong eating here. The service leaves a lot to be desired.   Sidenote: they love to put avocado on everything.

Went here for sushi for a change of pace (we usually go to Kan Pai).  It's a little far for me, but the sushi was good.  They had a late night happy hour that was 20% off everything after 9pm, I believe.  If it was closer, I'd probably be a regular.

Let me tell you about sushi bomb. I dated a guy that lived around the corner years ago so it was convenient. I moved farther away so didn't go for awhile. No other sushi place I went to compared. Now that I live in the area again, I can walk up there.  I have people come from the other side of town to join me.  Sushi places can be a little indistinguishable sometimes. This place is great. They have my favorite roll that I've never seen duplicated elsewhere. Love Affair!!! It's a little sweet. Do that with a spicy roll. Amazing!  And try the Tasmanian Sea Trout.  Spectacular.  It's kinda small in there so if you go at 7 on a Friday or Saturday night, there's going to be a wait. It's worth it.
Food was great, love the atmosphere, would eat here again!  The server initially turned me off with his attitude but I quickly picked up on his humor.

My friend had been here before so we decided to go one night. We went for AYCE dinner ($27) and it was very enjoyable. We sat at the bar but it really doesn't make a difference here as a waiter still takes your order. Service was fast and friendly. My favorite roll of the night was the white house. The fish is great quality!! I also tried honey toast for dessert...it's honey drizzled toast with vanilla ice cream and will be the reason why I go back...it was AMAZING!!!!!!!!! Highly recommend to finish with honey toast!

Great service and great food! This is my favorite sushi spot!!! I'm here at least once a month. I've never had a bad experience here. I'm not a fan of eel or shrimp and Danny the manager recommended rolls that didn't have them and he even told the sushi chefs to substitute things for me. Love this place!

My husband and I LOVE this place. It's close to our house and we always get exactly what we want. It has improved over the last few years and it seems like the owners are running a smart business model and reinvesting in the establishment. They have expanded the menu more then once and updated the tables and chairs, light fixtures, etc. The fish is always fresh and well tempered. The all you can eat deal is competitive with other places ($27/person for dinner). If my husband liked sushi as much as I do we would eat here 3 times per week!

The Sushi is really good and fresh. No complaints! The place is small which is not a big deal. Since it's in a residential environment the place feels cosy and not saturated like other sushi places in town. I would definitely give it a try if you live in the area.

Fun sushi place with modern decor.  The all-you-can-eat includes everything on the menu which is awesome (includes apps and deserts!).  Watch out for rolls with banana and creamy sauces, as they are super rich and can fill you up too quickly.

Bukake!  hehehehe!  :P  That's a roll they offer, I don't really know what it means.    Now on to the review.  Maybe my expectations were high because of their location or the price I saw on their dinner AYCE (all you can eat) at $27 but I was dissapointed.  I ordered my usual nigiri first and I got three orders of tuna, two orders of salmon, one order of garlic tuna, one order of scallops to start.  They were out of Uni!  I would rather they be out of uni rather than serve me some bad or foul uni like some other places.  When they brought out my nigiri, all of them were on the same plate which meant the garlic tuna sauce contaminated the rice on the other nigiri.  While my friend and I were eating, I noticed that they kept the rolls and other nigiri on a counter and wouldn't deliver the food you ordered out right away.  I think they were trying to keep a nice eating tempo but I'd rather they bring all of the dish out right away, especially if they were baked or hot orders!  Have to take a star off for that.  The server didn't take our order on a piece of paper so we didn't get all the rolls or items we ordered.  That's why I like how some places have those papers where you can jot down what you want.  Another dissapointment.    Mind you there were only 2 other customers at the time so I expected service to be immaculate.  As far as the nigiri goes, I think they noticed that I caught on to the amount of rice that was given and they used a dab too much rice vinegar.  On my second order of nigiri, I had two orders of tuna, one order of salmon, sweet shrimp, oysters (you can only have one order), and two orders of salmon roe.  The portions were finally the way I liked it with the fish covering the rice and not the rice looking like a nice comfy bean bag for my fish to sleep comfortably on.  The freshness of the fish is good, they've got that right.    After I eat about 30 pieces of nigiri I go on to the rolls, but I like to order half rolls which I've been spoiled by other sushi places that allow it.  They don't allow it here.  So take note of that!  They have some funny names for their rolls.  I ordered two rolls (which could have been 4 half rolls...) and one of them being some secret eel roll which I did not enjoy at all because the center was spicy tuna.  I thought it would have been all eel.  My friend ordered some other roll which had a puffy creamy ball top which was bland.  I had to help her clean up her rolls because she didn't enjoy it.  We were actually thankful that they didn't get our orders right because the rolls were not headed towards the right direction.  I had one good roll which had a shrimp tempura middle but I would have rather ordered 10 more pieces of nigiri instead of that eel secret special roll.    You can only order one dessert per AYCE and even though I had great company and we still had a great time eating okay food.  They have drink specials and one other thing they have going for them is the beer special that accompanies the AYCE.  Drinking wise this place would be the bomb.

Pretty good AYCE sushi here on my side of town!  There aren't very many sushi joints in the NW for us to partake in, especially of the AYCE variety.  I can probably count a small handful of places, and not all of them warrant a repeat visit.  I'm happy to say Sushi Bomb is a great option for AYCE sushi near us!    I gotta be honest though, out of all the various rolls we ate...I cannot remember the names of any of them!  I forgot to take a good pic of the actual menu!  All I can tell you is the night the wifey & I were at Sushi Bomb we ate good.  Stuffed to the gills good.  While Sushi Bomb is not one of my top places for AYCE sushi, it's up there with a more than enjoyable place to go.  We went for dinner on a Friday night (payday, yay), and even at 8 PM the place was lively with a lot of patrons...lots of kids too!  I know it's not considered KOSHER, but my favorite AYCE sushi restaurants are the ones that also offer a number of non-sushi appetizers to go with dinner.  Not traditional, but I like having a break from the endless amounts of rice that come your way with ordering sushi roll after sushi roll.  Some of the apps we tried:  -Chilean Sea Bass (daily special) - this was sooo good! -Chicken Yakitori  As a rule of thumb - for sushi rolls at an AYCE place we usually stick to the higher priced items on the menu.  Why get a Cali Roll from the menu if you really don't have to?  Come on...live a little!  Try that soft shell crab!  Get some crispy salmon skin!  Sample that extra spicy tuna!  We got a nice selection of Sushi Bomb's special rolls, tempura rolls, chef special rolls, and baked rolls.    Honestly, from what I remember they were all tasty!  I know it doesn't help that it wasn't all that memorable, but at least for us the quality was there.  The rice to fish ratio was on spot, there wasn't too much rice.  And their sushi rice was very good too - not gummy or overly sticky.  For myself, I love those baked rolls.  Something about the warm mayo mix that comes from under the salamander, just makes a roll delicious.  Wifey on the other hand though hates warm mayo with a passion...ha ha ha!  AYCE also comes with a dessert per person.  But this was pretty forgettable because the desserts we got were not on par with the food earlier:  -Honey Toast -Tempura Banana   If you see the pictures, both desserts look the same!  Covered in a scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocolate drizzle.  The Honey Toast was terrible!  It literally was a Hawaiian sweet bread roll cut in half and baked for a few minutes to make it somewhat toasty.  The Tempura Banana wasn't much better, heavy on the batter and thin on the banana.  I would skip dessert the next time or just get a scoop of ice cream to finish the meal.  Dinner is about $28 a person before tax, average with other AYCE sushi places in town.  Service was OK, but a bit rushed I think because for the AYCE you are limited to 1 hour.  There was enough time though to order another round of rolls though so I wouldn't worry too much unless you have a huge party.  We'll give Sushi Bomb another try...next time I'll be sure to remember all those rolls!

I'm always hesitant on trying new sushi places, but I'm glad I chose this one. The bacon roll is definitely a reason I'm coming back to this hole in the wall sushi bar. The all you can eat is a bit pricy for the menu selection but the food was amazing. Left satisfied and willing to return for more.

Terrible service tonight....rude tried to make us leave early like 40 minuted before its closed.  They tried to not give us our buy one get one free.  And to top it all off....they put gratuity on our party of 5 when it clearly states 6 people for gratuity.  Om calling management and im going to complain....worse service ever. They didnt bring all of our orders and they tried to bpame EVERYTHING on the new guy.  We asked if we can split the bill 3 ways it was fine, but when we had to pay, they changed ot to 2 ways and that was already wheb we were about to pay.  So I dont want to go here anymore.  GREAT FOOD TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE SERVICE.  ON TOP OF THAT TRYING TO GET MORE MONEY OUT OF YOU EVEN WHEN THE PRICES ARE POSTED eVERYWHERE.  Cheaters rude and terrible

Sushi Bomb was great! Our servers were very friendly and attentive. And the radish wrapped sushi was very good! I'd list all the types of sushi I ate but to be honest, I can't remember the names. I will tell you we ordered about 23 items and they were all good!

The Worst Service!!! Very small, the service was lousy, our server (lady) lied to us about our food order when it was never brought to our table! My husband's Sushi smelled and tasted extremely fishy. Too many other great Sushi Restaurants in town to waste your money on this place. Will never go there again and I would not recommend this place.
One of the best sushi places I've been to in town. Not sure if they still have it but the warm spring is awesome. Mmm

My boss loves this place, he is always telling me how great it is, but I had never been because it's too far north. Today my boss decided we should have a lunch meeting at Sushi Bomb, and since I love sushi I was not about to argue with him!  When we arrived we were the only people in the entire place. The hostess/waitress was friendly and efficient. Since it was 'his place' I let my boss order some things to get us started. He went with an order of edamame, some eggrolls and this fried jalapeno thing, I can not recall the name but it was like a popper, deep fried and stuffed with cream cheese.   The edamame was perfect, a nice large portion with just enough salt. The eggrolls were also good, on the small side but thats ok because I didn't want to get full on appetizers. I never eat jalapenos, but after some arm twisting I gave these a try... Was glad I did because they were not hot at all.   For the rest of our meal we decided on the the bj, the I love tuna and vegas rolls. Everything tasted great, the tuna tasted very fresh. The Vegas roll was my favorite, mmm cream cheese.   I'd go back to Sushi Bomb for sure if it was closer to me...

My favorite sushi spot!! The food is delicious and the service is great. Philly rolls will always be my number one, but their Sushi Bomb roll is not far behind. AYCE is definitely the best option. There are so many appetizers and rolls to choose from. They allow you to order half a roll for your last order. Also, they include dessert to complete the meal.

Went last night... HORRIBLE service and to top it off, the "Buy 2 get 1 free" is no longer promoted there.   I wouldn't have been so disappointed in my first visit to Sushi Bomb if it weren't for our server. Seemed like she was upset to be at work! 3 of us went and the bill came out to $100... If I'm paying that much money to sit down and eat, I expect better service than what I got last night.  Needless to say, I will NEVER return to this business.

Family friendly.  Dropped in for some dinner with the family one night. The menu was pretty standard but the service was the great and best part of this business. Everyone was attentive and pleasent.  My son was given a high chair and the chefs  had fun giving him custom little fruits with bird faces which he loved it!  Recommend the banana crab dish!! Pretty amazing.  Overall Service: 4-5 Food: 3-5 Drink: 3-5 Price: $$ Come back: yes
Best sushi in town!!!!!!! Crowded but definitely worth it!!!!! Kid friendly too!!!!! Staff was super friendly and very attentive. Prepare to wait if you go during dinner time!
Tried this place again and I was very pleased. They have a ton of great items and it comes out fast. Dinner AYCE has a nice selection of one item orders.

This is the third time we have eaten here. Once again the food was incredibly fresh. We did AYCE and it was delicious.   I had a spicy tuna salad , cold soba noodles and a Tuna Lover 'a Roll . All good!  My husband checked in and got a free Sapporo.  This place has been consistently good- service and food wise.

We've eaten here many times and have always enjoyed it! Tonight was super busy but our server "Mac" was awesome! He was fast, friendly and checked on us frequently which in a full restaurant isn't always easy! Our dinner and dessert was fresh and delicious! Thanks Mac!

I always feel like open late sushi joints are danger. Eat lots of rice and then go to sleep. That's how sumo tori bulk up. Kanak attack.  I've come here a couple times for late night AYCE ($27). Being that you can order ANYTHING off of the menu and the chalkboard specials and it's all under the AYCE umbrella, that's a pretty great deal. Some of their menu items included hamachi kama and okinomiyaki.   I really feel like the true testament to the nuts of a sushi place is in their nigiri. Find out what you wanna know ... it's in his fish. Anyways, the nigiri was kind of wussy, thin pieces of fish. Nothing exceptional, but also nothing catastrophic.   I think it's worth mentioning that all of the employees are Korean. There were three parties at the bar and no one else in the restaurant. The THREE sushi chefs behind the bar seemed to have trouble keeping up with orders.   The waiter boy isn't like a beck and call kind of guy. If you really want something, you'll have to stare at the back of his head for a bit.   #offthestrip #noncasino

Sushi is one of my favorite food pleasures and Sushi Bomb did not disappoint! The service was excellent and they stayed on top of refilling our drinks and taking our orders. The appetizers and sushi were so flavorful. I highly recommend them if you enjoy good sushi!

This is by far the BEST sushi I've had in Vegas. I'm from San Diego so sushi is my life. And I'm a very tough judge on it cause I used to eat it fresh caught every day. And this place hands down has the best and freshest tasting fish I've had out here. The salmon sushi or sashimi literally melts in your mouth. And every roll that I've tried so far has amazing flavor and I don't get all the baked ones and stuff, I stay on the healthier side with more raw fish in no rice rolls ect. And all the fish has wonderful flavor. Love this place and have been going a lot! Highly recommended
great service great food and selection, my family enjoyed the sushi, I don't eat sushi but there are a lot of other choices, the chicken teriyaki was delicious!

Food is great, service was good and the atmosphere is casual and cute. Rolls were fresh and tasty and you can't beat the price for their ayce. I've been here a few times before and I'll definitely return again.

Bad service and rude from an attitude waitress, big fat long hair asian, Jennifer (I believe that is her name). She only took orders and never came checked on us.   We were eating and enjoying our food with our companies - not loud,  not picky, or being a trouble maker. Other two severs,  a young boy and a young girl,  are great through - taking care of drinks and emtry plates away with great customer service. Food is all right.   After we ordered the 2nd round,  the attitude fat asian server, she came and said ''oh you know the policy right! (Look at my friend) yeah,  you know. We charge for left over" Then walked away! We were looking at each other like,  "what was that!" But we did not think it was a big deal.   After the 2nd round of food were served, we were eating. Then she stopped for the second time and said,  "you must eat all of rice too!" Then walked away.  What?!?!  Really!!!,  she needed to do that again. We did not ask your policy or had a lot of food on the plate! Now, we felt like she hated us for a reason as we were specificlly threaten to charge more.   FYI: we finished the 1st set of order and were still eating our 2nd round of food. It is normal that some rice or ingredients were dropped on the plate as some sushi is loose or too big to the mouth. We did not have bunch of rice or food left over in the plate neither. We have been eating all you can eat sushi at many restuarants in Las Vegas and many cities for years and never had a server came and thread us in my whole life. This was a wow...   She might be a manager or partner so she has a ball to say that to us. It is very rude and inappropriate!! If she would charge me for a piece of rice,  go head and I don't mind to pay. If I don't have money to spend,  i wouldn't go there and eat at your restaurant. Don't need to be attitude and thread a customer like this! So unprofessional and lack of customer service.

My boyfriend and I went here years ago and had a terrible experience, but I am so glad we have it another shot! We went I again on a whim the other night and it was so delicious. The fish is super fresh and the service is great. There are tons of options on both the regular menu and the all you can eat. We are so happy to have an awesome sushi spot so close to home!!

The food was excellent. The spicy garlic edamame was soooo delicious that I didn't want to share. I know it's just soy beans, but it was great. Then there was "the best chicken fried rice" that my husband's ever had. Then there were the extremely filling bento boxes that my kids ordered. And I haven't even gotten to the sushi rolls yet - the Hulk (soft shell crab topped with more soft shell crab & avocado); the 007 (California roll with shrimp on top); spicy tuna & octopus... Very very yummy! We didn't order anything really exotic because if the basics are good, the specialties are usually better. Also considering that they only had two servers at dinner-time on Saturday evening, the service was pretty attentive. To cap off our meal we had a banana split consisting of tempura fried banana, a scoop of vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, caramel & a cherry on top. Good stuff. We'll be back.
Love this place. I always crave the ex gf roll! Best place for ayce on the NW part of town.

I came here couple of days ago to do ayce with my family and it caught me off guard! What a pleasant surprise. They accomodated us even though we had a big group and service was quick and attentive. I wish i took pictures of the food we had but we were too busy eating lol sushi bomb roll is amazing and they also have draft sapporo beers for $3 a glass if you do ayce. They had unlimited bluefin tuna with ayce as their daily specials and i think we ordered almost 10 orders!!! I cant get enough of their porkbelly and spicy garlic edamame. It was super packed and had a long line out the door but it was well worth the wait. Cant wait to come back!

You say sushi.... I say bomb....bomb!!! I found this place on Yelp attempting to meet my friend half way. I never knew this street had so many sushi places! I love the decor inside ...they have some really cool pictures adorning their walls.  I ordered a specialty roll I forgot the name but it had the word pearl in it. The rolls were topped with shrimp that had a bit of zing to it. They were little bits of deliciousness!  I also had the spicy scallop rolls which were also good.  I liked that they didn't rush my friend and I out after our meal. We stayed for about two more hours chatting. We asked them if it was okay and they were cool with it.

Tried AYCE, it was good except for the rolls were huge so I only ate 2. Really a ripoff if you ask me.  Everything was terrible on a third visit. They forgot my order, so while my wife ate her dinner, I stewed over the poor service. When I finally got my salad and sushi roll, both tasted horrible!
I absolutely love this place! Friendly service and delicious  Can't wait to go for my birthday soon

First of all, the all you can eat  price does not include nigiri And sashimi. Second of all, love affair roll that was highly recommended by the manager looked and tasted like sugared-fried cardboard. Their other highly recommended roll called this guy tasted like salted matza on rice.  Disgusting. Lastly, I personally love uni, and when we tried ordering it, they said they were out of uni?!! Really!?!  Overall, some rolls were okay, but I don't know if we'll ever come back here again.

Cool lodge-y looking place. Was disappointed the California roll was minced crab meat; I prefer chunked. Green tea had a nice flavor. Overall service was good, food was good too. We'll be coming back.
Food is great. But service is horrible!!! I used to come here all the time but it seems like the staff just went down the drian.

While on my lunch break,  I went in to place a few small orders to go.  This is a place I have been a few times,  I have not had this issue before.  The host was arrogant when telling  me that they could not run any orders for less then $10 on a credit cards. I told him I have done this before with no issues and he proceeded to tell me he had been there for 8 yearsand that's policy.  This is a big inconvenience and I will not be returning.

Very cute hole in the wall place.  When you walk in it's like Little Tokyo.  The quality of the fish is excellent...fresh, savory, and the right proportion (rice to fish ratio).  Their AYCE pricing is not bad...$18ish for lunch and $25ish for dinner.  Otherwise, the rolls al carte is reasonably priced. $7-$13.  They also have an great promo going right now if you go with friends--buy 2 AYCE and get 1 free.   Try the Love Me Long Time roll.  One of my favorites!  The staff is friendly,  fast service, and the restaurant is very clean. I love that they are open till 1am on Saturday nights.    **Fun side note: if you sit at the sushi bar,  they have this really cool toy box.  You put a quarter there and a cat comes out of the box to take it--hilariously cute.

Fresh and delicious!  Presentation was top notch.   Variety of rolls is amazing!   Hubby and son got the all you can eat and they enjoyed every bite!   I had the Spicy Tuna and Jalapeño rolls and cucumber salad!  Service is friendly and fast! The Asian decor is  pleasing and welcoming.   My first time and I will be back!

I have been looking for a great sushi place since I came out here from California.  The fish is excellent and fresh, and they do not overload their rolls with mayo like some competitors in the area. The decor is airy and hip.  Recommend Mr. D's roll and all of the sashimi plates.  Prices are fair - just took 6 of us to dinner for my boyfriend's bday, grubbed down and drank like fish (no pun intended) and our bill was under $150.  Love this place.
Good food.  Take forever for drinks to get refilled or would have rated at 4 stars.
Delicious and all you can eat is not too expensive! Love it! Coconut lover is my favorite :)
This place is great. Best sushi in the Northwest without a doubt, especially if you like it fresh and flavorful. Sonny is a great host. Great friendly, neighborhood atmosphere.

I should have been clear about the restaurant size, I think they have a little over a dozen tables, and about 8 seats at the bar. Now that I have been there a few more times, for dinner it is always pretty busy. Unfortunately, because the food is so good, this is a place where people really come to eat & almost everyone goes for the AYCE(all you can eat) No time limit option.... you know what that means- the Tables don't turn over that fast, but it is so worth the wait, if you had bad timing.  If you have 2 other friends with you, you have to go grab a bite, after 9PM, when it is buy 2 AYCE & get the 3rd FREE! There is also a $4 All You Can Drink: Draft Beer, if you get the AYCE, THAT'S INSANE! 1 Sapporo cost at least $5 everywhere else!

This place is great! The staff was friendly and attentive. The decor was nice and the music was not-too-loud, fun Asian pop.   And the food was delicious! Reasonable all-you-can-eat prices from a huge menu. I even got oysters! The Rock & Roll and Fire Rainbow rolls were my favorites.   What a great find! I'll be back.

My coworkers all claim they have the best sushi place in town so we decide every few weeks we will try a different coworkers spot.  The price is average what I was expecting for AYCE but has a nice yelp deal for a free house sake or Sapporo.  The food was good not the best I've ever had for AYCE.  The reason I have this place three stars was the waitresses needed to be flagged down every time my group was there a little over an hour and only one water refill.  My glass sat empty for 28 minutes but I couldn't give this place lower than three stars because the food even though the customer service was atrocious.

I came back to edit my post. I had an extremely negative comment about how they had a waiter that was mean to the customers and that I wouldn't be returning because of his service. However, since then they have fired that waiter and the restaurant has done a complete 180.  They have always had good food, no one every doubted that, but their service was rude. Now the service is great and you can actually enjoy the food! Sometimes the rolls can be a little too big and hard to eat, but my boyfriend asked if they could make them a little smaller so they were easier to eat and they happily did, it came out with more pieces that were smaller so it was the same amount of food.   I'm sure we'll be back a lot because they are extremely close by and we do love their sushi, and now that they have fixed the service issue nothing gets in the way of enjoying that food.   Highlight: lunch special all you can eat is only $20. :D

Best all you can eat on the northwest side of town! Typical pricing for dinner, I always love the mussels here and the rolls are not small like other AYCE spots. They have many great choices! Try the refreshing roll called "Red Rock".
Wow. An AYCE sushi restaurant that doesn't overstuff every roll with imitation crab! How amazing. The real winner for me here though was the oysters. So.Darn.Good. Xoxo EatWithReese

If I could give negative I would Walked in at 1:39 on a Saturday No one waiting in front of us but the restaurant was clearing from a lunch rush The waiter told us it would only be a few minutes for tables to clear, which he was right, but they ignored us and we didn't get sat until 1:57 even though tables had been empty for over 10 minutes 2 more parties came in while we were waiting and we all got sat simultaneously, however the last party got their drinks first and we were completely ignored. While waiting I also witnessed the waiter deliver the wrong roll to 2 wrong tables, and when he realized his mistake he picked up the rolls from the wrong tables and served them to the correct people We left after waiting at the table and when I called them to let them know what happened the tall waitress answered and said she couldn't help us because it wasn't her section. Stay away!! Their nigiri is poor quality and will make you sick So mad at myself for trying to give them a second chance. Beware!
Ironically, the sushi is bomb. Anyone that lives on Kanye's daughters side of Vegas (North West) and you're craving sushi, stop by Sushi Bomb.
Consistently great sushi! Nice atmosphere. Chefs and servers are polite and welcoming. We should've watched Final Four here!

Ive been to multiple all you can eat restaurants and I've never been to one that actually charges you if you don't finish your food... (picture included) of the items I didn't eat which, was gross, hence why I didn't finish it... and they would not put down a fight. The coconut shrimp was good, but I'll never make the trip out here again. Staff wasn't anything to write home about... I rather go to Doh or jjenga. Update-- didn't end up charging us after telling us they were going to.
Great food and awesome service.  I try to go once a week. Paul is the best server there. Highly recommend sushi bomb

They had a lot of variety and the fish was fresh. I liked the decor of the restaurant, although my only complaint is there is no stamp card system for the AYCE Sushi. The servers were friendly and the food arrived in timely manner, for the most part. When I went the restaurant was pretty busy which was a good sign to see. I will definitely come back as they have won me over as a returning patron. I do wish they had halibut on their menu, that would make this my all time favourite sushi spot to eat at. It's really nice it's at a convenient location right off the highway as well.

Came here with my hubby for the first time and we were very impressed with the service and how fresh and delicious the food was.  I will most definitely come back again.  This will be our spot!!! Good thing we live right around the corner.
The name says everything. The sashimi portion are small and expensive. Not a fan of all u can eat sushi bars. Service for get it. Pass on this bomb.

Ehh it was ok. I'm a fan of authentic Japanese sushi/cuisine. This place is not that. I'm not crazy about all the sauce on almost every roll here.  I followed a previous yelper and I tried the warm springs roll..sweet spicy like dessert!

One of the best sushi joints I've been to so far.  I thought the food was of a lot better quality than most other "all you can eat's" out there.  It's a pretty relaxed atmosphere.  The waiter seemed a tad inexperienced, but he was very friendly so I didn't mind.  I've only been there for dinner, so I can only vouch for that.  It's pretty expensive though.  Expect to pay around $60 for two at dinnertime.  That's only if you follow the rules and don't leave any leftovers.

This is THE PLACE !... FRESH! FRESH! FRESH! That's why we come here when we crave for sushi, sashimi and other cooked dishes. All You Can Eat is our favorite choice and a great value @ 27.00!    Food is served fresh individually as you order.  My favorite is Grilled Salmon Collar, cooked perfectly! So is the fresh n tasty smoked whole mackerel, done right. Outstanding pork belly and teriyaki beef dishes too.  Delicious soups and salads compliment the dishes perfectly.  Service is above average!

Horrible service on 5/11/15 at 5:30pm.  Been coming here for a few years!  Sushi was slow and not their best (that I've had.)  I'll be going elsewhere for a little while, and will return sometime later.  Get better Sushi Bomb...I love you guys!

All you can eat but with high grade sushi   Menu is broken up with colored dots to let you know what you can have.  Blue dots are al a carte only, stars mean you can 1 order per diner. Green diamond is dinner only. The rolls are well worth it.  This particular Sunday they had a special on half rolls. Worked out since my wife is a light water. One of the rules is you must finish everything or you get charger full price. Makes sense since some people will order everything and eat half of it. Japanese lasagna is awesome. Tuna poke with seaweed salad was very good as well. Dessert options are many, only complaint was you get 1 mochi only. Should get at least 2
Nice and clean plus friendly staff.  All you can eat costumers, make sure to order a lot of food at first because they take a while to come back for a new order.

I found this place yelping while driving around the new neighborhood that I just moved in to. It was around 6pm on a Saturday night and our party of 4 was seated immediately and greeted by our waiter Paul, who was an amazing server.  As any good server would, Paul immediately checked if we all had a setting, gave us menus and took our drink orders. Looking at the menu (each roll roughly priced around $12) AYCE is definitely the way to go.  When Paul came back with our waters and drinks he asked if he could get any appetizers started. We ordered the Garlic Edamame (amazing! Probably the best I've had at a AYCE place), Cold Tofu Salad (comes with a great and tasty sauce), cucumber salad, sea weed salad and oysters. Unfortunately after taking our order and putting it in, Paul had to come back to let us know that they ran out of oysters. It would have been nice for him to let us know before hand. He did recommend other alternatives and his favorites, which I appreciated.   We ordered many rolls but my top favorites were: 1.) coconut lovers roll 2.) salmon lovers roll 3.) BBQ rib roll 4.) Baja yellowtail roll 5.) Sushi bomb roll   Don't forget to end your Sushi Bomb experience with dessert! The Honey Toast is mouth watering greatness!   I am very impressed with this AYCE place. Great quality. Amazing service. And such good food. I'm glad Yelp brought us together and I hope to be back soon. It's a bummer that they got rid of the promotions that the other reviews talk about like the all you can drink draft beer with AYCE sushi for 4.99 and the buy two get one free deal! :( *if you read those reviews note that the promos are no longer going on.*

Im actually giving this place 4 1/2 stars. It was my first time here. I am usually a visitor of Sin City Sushi or Yama Sushi. So I wanted to try something different. This place definitely lived up to my expectations. Did the AYCE. Wide variety of rolls. Service was great. The speed that the rolls came out was perfect. Would definitely go again.
Loove this place and the food! it is so good and the customer service is good...not great but good.

This is my second time at Sushi Bomb! The fish was really fresh! The have rolls that are not typical and are fantastic! We will be back for sure! Our favorites were Sushi Bomb roll, the DJ roll, and the Tonight roll!
I always order from this place like 4 times a month and I nevered had a bad experienced. Food is great ! Oysters are fresh ! & the service are awesome :)

I decided to try it out because coworkers rave about it. Their all you can eat was a definite plus. The sushi is okay. The service was excellent. The only prob I had was how my server decided to initiate my last meal to a half and cut me off of the all you can eat because once you cut your sushi from 8 rolls to 4, YOUR DONE! She should have recommended a smaller size rolls or a salad.

Had the crispy rice; my favorite, but it was a little too thin and too heavy on the spicy tuna.  I was extremely pleased with the service, cleanliness and the expectation she set with the order (how much time it would take to cook). Not wow'd by food but loved the service.
Sushi Bomb is one of my favorite sushi places in vegas. Everytime I visit I make it a point to stop by for the AYCE and great service!!

I wasn't sure how many stars to give. The FOOD is great. Love the X girlfriend roll. However the service is TERRIBLE. Been here many times and every time I get the same grumpy would rather not be here service. I will probably not be going back.

Wanted sushi, but did not want to go far,  Yelp helped me this sushi bar close to my home in Centennial Hills.  I was quite pleased with their all you can eat menu.  The slices of fish on the nigiri sushi were some of the biggest I've had here in Las Vegas.   The only thing I found off putting was the music, a strange mix of rap and country.  Also they don't have a card to stamp that adds up to a free meal, but overall I was impressed.
Great food plus good prices and clean friendly environment.  Love the hot and spicy edamame.
It's just meh. We have never dined in, only had to go but the sushi isn't anything to be wooed over. It's ok.
so damn good! Friday night is busy but its always good and staff is great.  AWESOME just awesome.  My favorite is the La roll

Not the best out there but it sure beats a lot of the competition.   The all you can eat value deal is the reason I go.   The number of options that they have with california rolls is astounding. I have not encountered one thing I didn't like on the menu yet, either.   The only trouble I have ever had here is when I showed up late. I thought they were open for another hour. I got the buffet option and then only had 15 minutes to eat it all up. I was hoping they would cut me some slack, but no, they had to get going. Not entirely their fault, I know. Would have been nice to have had a few extra minutes to dine though.

Been here twice so far for sushi. Got sick the first time within a couple hours of eating. Thought we'd give it another try again tonight and see and I was sick again. Would not recommend. Have eaten at several other places in town and not had an issue. Not sure what it is about this place. I wanted to like it but I can't.

We've always had a great experience here. They recently redid their menu and the food got even better. Plus, the ambiance in here is the nicest of the local sushi restaurants.   All of their rolls are great (we have tried almost all, and would probably order all again) - my husband loves the New Mexico roll, and it's good but a bit heavy on the cilantro. My favorite used to be the rabbit pearl, but I think they got rid of it. The orange blossom is good, Red Rock roll is good, and their namesake roll is good.   You can only order a half roll as your last order, so order wisely.

AYCE is the way to go.  If you order a couple of rolls and dessert you have paid the equivalent of the AYCE price.  Several appetizers are delicious the edamame with garlic, baked mussels and dynamite dish are good starters.  They do not pack the rolls with a lot of rice like other AYCE places. They have a great variety of rolls  & they arrive in a reasonable amount of time.   They will work with you if you have allergies with no attitude which is refreshing !  Dessert is included if you can save room. My favorite rolls are  The monster roll The Vegas roll Spicy tiger  Shrimp lover roll Philly roll

I come in here literally every week & I love it. It's my go to sushi place nearby. Except the last 2 months so recently the prices went up & the rolls got somewhat smaller so that's quite disappointing.

I really enjoy the food here. I had Edamame, a California roll and Chicken Katsu. The service is average. There's a minimum charge on credit card so I ordered a Sapporo and it was fine. I will be back but it's not my go to sushi place.
Wow, they call it sushi bomb because I am about to explode!  Came here for lunch with wife and daughter.  We were pleasantly surprised.  Thanks to by BFFs at yelp we gave it a try!

This used to be mine and my friends favorite spot. Don't know if we'll be back. Food took forever. And when we were done 4 different people came to our table to ask if we are ok like within a 10 minute span. Most restaurants it's kind of obvious if the guest isn't eating anymore or ordering anymore food, and says they are ok, they are waiting for their check. This waitress came up and said with a snobby attitude if we are done yet? Yeah!! We were waiting to get our check! Then after she asked us 3 other people asked if we need our check. Way to make a guest feel like you're rushing them to get out, but the kicker is we were ready to leave but waiting for them to get our check. The only nice person was our waiter I would have rather just dealt with him instead the other waitresses especially the snobby one.

Hello Again!  I have written a review about Sushi Bomb before (back in Nov 2011), but this time, I have to say, I won't be going back :(  The last review I gave them was 4 out of 5...Only a 4 cause of how slow the service was during lunch.    My friends and I dined there last night (March 30, 2012).  It was a Friday evening and it was another couple and our son who is 1yr 1/2 old.    So our bad journey began with slow service and a very very rude waitress.  I should have gotten her name (there are only a few servers that work there - she was the slightly older skinnier Asian lady server.  The younger one with wavy hair was very very nice!    Our bill was over $170 - All you can eat and drinks.  So for paying this kind of money at any restaurant for 4 people, would EQUAL = = = = GREAT SERVICE!  Wrong.  Our reservations was for 7:15.  We did not get out of the restaurant until after 10pm.  This was not our choice because our son was ready long LONG before.  I told my friends that our lunch service was slow and given that the restaurant seemed busy, I suggested that we try and order all your rolls at one time.  We ordered most or rolls so we didn't have to wait as long.  However, we needed a couple more.  I guess when you order more after the first round, you will have to wait cause others will be priority over you... or so it seemed.    When I told the guy (Host-with a girly kind of hair cut-not trying to be mean, just didn't get his name and that's the only way I could describe him) who said he is the manager, his explanation was and I quote "the first round of sushi you probably had a fast sushi chef and they are all different, this time, you probably had a slower sushi chef and his speed is slower than the first guy that made your food"   :o  WHAT??     We waited over 40minutes from when we ordered a couple more rolls before they came out (after a couple complaints too).  The server would barely ask us what we wanted nor did she seem happy to be there.  She was in a bad mood.  I totally get it, we all have bad days and we have busy days too that can drive us to the ground, but when the economy is the way it is (people seem to be pickier about where to eat or spend their money on), then I think customer service is going to help any business fail or succeed.  Bottom line, we should not have been treated the way we did.    -We asked for waters twice. -We waited over 15 min. for her to take our order the first time. -We had to keep asking for refills  -We asked for 2 cucumber salads in the beginning and never got them - until about almost 10pm cause they new at this point we were upset - we even said never mind on the cucumber salads  -We were treated horribly by our server the entire night (with the exception of the Host/Manager & that other server that tried to make it better)  -Our rolls the second time took over 40min. to come out - we did not order anything different than the last time, with the exception of us ordering only 3 rolls - lot less than the first round  Unfortunately, because of all the series of events that happened last night with the slow service and the extremely rude server, etc. etc. Our entire group will not go back.  There are far more sushi places that would deserve our time/money than this place.    I do not recommend this place to anyone with kids or anyone that wants to leave within less than 2 hours, especially for dinner.  I do have to say the best roll there is Sex on the Beach.   The all you can drink Sapporo for $3.99 is a good deal.   Make a reservation!!  We did and it helped but there were people waiting outside. Unfortunately for us, all of these things though will not help us go back.  I rather drive all the way to "I Love Sushi" in Henderson that isn't an all you can eat and pay just as much or a little more because I know they are deserving of my business.    I hope someone from Sushi Bomb reads this because I hope you improve on your customer service!!   Just a side note: We tried to tip the other nice server (cause she started to help us a little more at the end) and she said they all have to share the money - community tips.  Where is the incentive to do better and be a better server and treat people better?  There really isn't with this type of tipping service.    Overall bad time and we all left frustrated.  Our night didn't end well and that's not right.  :(  Sushi Bomb dropped a bomb on our night! It shook us up so much, they we are not going back!

One of my favorite sushi spots because it actually looks fairly nice inside. Can't stand restaurants who don't take pride in their atmosphere. Food was good as usual. Only issue issue I have is with front if house service. Not terrible. Just needs improvement.

My husband and I stopped in tonight for dinner. We were seated at the bar by a women server who then took our drink order and walked away. We waiting a few minutes thinking she was going to come back with a menu but she never returned. I then asked the sushi chef behind the bar if we could have a menu. He asked the same reserver who seated us if she would grab us a menu. I watched as she asked another server to help us because she went to go take a bigger party's order. We waited about 5 minutes and still no menu. So a total of 15 maybe 20 minutes no drinks bought to us and still no menu. As we got up to walk out she stood there and watched us leave. No attempt to apologize or say anything.  I give this place a 1 star based on customer service. Also I want to mention the place was not busy.

This is our sushi "go to" place. conveniently located in the neighborhood but more importantly it is the food here that earns my 5 stars.   We have been coming here for the past 2 years repeatedly when we crave sushi. Its very family friendly and authentic in depicting the japanese decor theme throughout.   My favorite roll here? The "Tonight" roll! Nice & spicy the way i like it.   The best time to come and the biggest bang for the buck is all you can eat lunch special which expires at 3 p.m.   We love Sushi Bomb! Cause its "Tha Bomb"!!

Horrible experience,  I been coming here since 2012 I got my stamp card. Two things happened. They gave me bad salmon. It was slimy and then they tried to charge me cause I didn't finished. When I ask to speak to manager the manager never came. They took care but for four pieces of sushi. I understand if I was being wasteful. But I wasn't. That will be my last visit here.

I came here again from out of town with family.  i got the same amazing service as i did from over a year ago and the sushi roll au du toilet is still on the menu and is atill as amazing as i remember.  Danny was once again my server and he even recognized me from the last visit.  The experience here is unparalleled from sushi to service always impress me and Danny is the man as always.

Sushi Bomb is a small but fantastic place to catch sushi and quickly leave.  Located in a small plaza in Cheyenne St by the 215, this is the place me and my buddies go after Church on a Sunday morning so it's never been busy or crowded for us.  They give you very big servings on sushi and sashimi. All you can eat lunch for $19.99.  Very easy to get full on just two sets of rolls here. Sonny our waiter (might be the manager too) is a very friendly guy and so are the other staff which you can regularly yelling out your order loud with heavy japanese accents.  All their special rolls are pretty tasty so you can't really go wrong with any choices.  But the common rolls, such as the california roll are no better than what you usually get from other sushi restaurants. I recommend going with a group of friends and order different specialty rolls so you all can have the chance to try different ones. They all have their own twist of flavor that will not disappoint.

3.5 stars for the food...5 stars for the value!  AYCE lunch is around $20, with an AYCD option for $5! I had 3 Sapporo drafts, at about $1.50 a piece!  Most of the fish tasted fresh, some with great flavor actually! A few seemed a little dry and not quite as fresh, but I only noticed that on some of the nigiri.  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bomb-las-vegas?select=53bUbCJxe5R69uRhPbJX7Q#53bUbCJxe5R69uRhPbJX7Q  I really enjoyed the Unagi here...it had a slight crispiness to the edges that added a lot of flavor and consistency!  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bomb-las-vegas?select=n_VviZZu0wZCAX_N4wGdBg#n_VviZZu0wZCAX_N4wGdBg  I really enjoyed the Sake Kama here!  They don't include the Hamachi kama in the AYCE, so the salmon had to tide me over! Had a great taste...better than most actually!  Probably the highlight of the lunch for me :)  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bomb-las-vegas?select=GityQ5CHwRvSUC36LtnJIA#GityQ5CHwRvSUC36LtnJIA  The rolls were great, with my most favorite being the Rabbit Pearl : Shrimp Tempura, Spicy Crab and Cucumber topped with Spicy Crab, Shrimp and Avocado...Spicy ponzu sauce and crunch!  This was easily the best roll we tried in my eyes! Perfect amount of spice and flavor!   Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bomb-las-vegas?select=TLsxftXGuTx6odSFz-lcKg#TLsxftXGuTx6odSFz-lcKg  I really liked how they include Yakitori as well! The beef was ok...a bit chewy, but good overall.
