Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bomb-las-vegas?select=vCJPc5iGyjaFVRR4OzMETQ#vCJPc5iGyjaFVRR4OzMETQ  But easily shadowed by the Scallops wrapped with Bacon! They were great and melted in your mouth!  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bomb-las-vegas?select=O3-khFYVdrmZjk-XRcqsfw#O3-khFYVdrmZjk-XRcqsfw   And of course, to finish for dessert...they had Honey Toast! Of course I had to try it...a few choices of ice cream, but the Green Tea actually had lots of tea flavor and was yummy! The toast itself was good, plenty of honey...and was overall a good choice!  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-bomb-las-vegas?select=Hz0hOXgNhwsPJNsuJA0GKA#Hz0hOXgNhwsPJNsuJA0GKA   I took many other pictures too, just click the tab on top of the review if you want to see the others.  Check them out if you are ever on this side of town...all the way on W Cheyenne and the 215!  It would be worth the drive to switch it up :)

This sushi restaurant has gone downhill.  It's so close to my home that my family has been ordering to go weekly for quite a while. In the last month our order has been wrong twice, and we are told the order will be ready in 20 minutes, arrive 30 minutes after placing our order to give some extra time and still made to sit and wait another 30 minutes!  For mediocre sushi and terrible waits and false promises try Sushi Bomb.....but don't say I didn't warn you.
Really good food & sake & service. Just a little quiet & boring but overall good experience. Also should add Mochi to the menu!

I have sent so many friends here and spent several nights a week sometime here eating sushi. I love the ALL YOU CAN EAT. Order the pork belly.. we get our extra crispy. You can order so much from the menu and it is all really fresh and good. The Spicy Edamame is also a favorite of mine. Have to order every time. If you like desert then order the honey toast.

I watched this place being built in my neighborhood when it was first coming to fruition and we were all so excited about having a sushi restaurant in the north west especially when it's slim pickings in this area Of great places to eat without having to drive down the hill on Cheyenne and of course this is before downtown Summerlin graced us with its presence. --it used to be fantastic.   The music was fun, and they even had a ladies night and they were open till 3 AM with a reverse happy hour into the late hours. It was phenomenal .  ...not only have we spent birthdays and numerous graduations since they opened obviously they have changed hands since then.   The food has always been good the service always has been impeccable and it's always been quite comfortable.   Until today. Someone formerly mentioned in our review recently that the service is all over the place and indeed it is. I sat down as I waited for my son to join me who was coming straight from work I was there about five minutes and barely had a sip of my water when I was approached by one of the head waiters and asked when my "party or a partner or friend" was arriving. I had barely put my purse down. I told him soon in about two minutes later my son arrived. Said waiter came back and took her order the food arrived promptly which was great and it was also delicious barely a bite into my salmon skin hand roll , which was greasy.and mediocre at best, and the waiter appeared again asking "what else were having for our second round," ...well I have a full mouth of food and have barely started enjoying my dinner, so I don't know if there will be a second round .... I just want to enjoy my dinner and the company I am with.   He obviously has had no social skills or tact when he waits on tables he was quite rude and pushy and honestly I have to say this is been happening for quite a while I've had this chubsy waiter before and he was pretty much a jerk ....there was about six people waiting on us.  It definitely doesn't have that personal neighborhood flare that it used to have. it almost seems like a assembly line of sushi which is really disappointing because I remember what it used to be like when it first opened. Which is really too bad because this is around the corner from my house and it really used to be our place to go. I thunk Sishi Kota has won over my business. It's far but I feel appreciated and don't mind paying for great service and great food, I work hard and deserve both.  Do t we all?

LOVE this place!!! I always do the AYCE and have yet to complain.  They have the BEST menu selection.  I have friends who don't really do the sushi thing, but their appetizer/cooked food menu offers more than just chicken teriyaki.  So, everyone is happy.  Their fish is fresh, the rolls are delicious (try the Sweet Tomato), and the restaurant itself is beautifully decorated.  The best part...lunch is only $21 and dinner is $26.  They also have a stamp card system - free ayce after 10 stamps.    As for all the complaints on the waiters...I haven't had an issue. You'd be surprised how far a genuine smile will take you =]
My favorite sushi place in town. Prompt, friendly service ands great atmosphere. Great full menu that does not disappoint. Appetizers are just as great as the rolls.

Best place and people EVER!!! Andy the head chef is absolutely amazing the nicest person you can ever meet. He converted me to a sushi lover, i would always come here with my wife and just get non sushi food till Andy got hired he had me try a couple of his specialty rolls and made me my own onion ring roll. Now I love sushi and don't mind when my wife asks to come here, I actually ask her now to come!! BEST BEST PLACE EVER!!!!

Ok so Im here with family my sister is the manager at a major restaurant on the strip. I have more thank than 10 years in the industry. And by far I have one of the worst experiences in a very long time. So we Hager there at 9 pm and hour prior closing and the told us that we only have 30 min. To order. So we ordered apps. And told the waitress to tell us when last call is so we can order sushi. We got AYCE $27 which is expensive for a neighborhood restaurant. But we all though I has to be really good......well it wasn't! All you can eat doesn't include a lot! Of things like most AYCE include. We were rushes the whole hour we were there...they did not bring every we ordered and at the end they still rushed us out and it wasn't 10pm yet. Truthfully I will never be back again and I will tell anybody on my neighborhood of the experienced we all had.

This place is 40 minutes from my house and I still travel that far just for this amazing sushi. I have been to over 30 sushi restaurants and this one has to be one of the absolute best. I did AYCE and I have to say my Favorite part is their appetizers. We tried almost all of them I loved them all. My favorite roll was the Love Affair roll. The restaurant was extremely clean which is a HUGE plus for me as well. Staff is super helpful in guiding you through the menu to get you exactly what you will love!

This review EASILY changing to a5 Outstanding on ALL fronts. Fresh fresh fresh food! And establishment appreciates return business on top of it all. Very unusual these days, but in clear evidence here! This is now MY place!

Newest sushi place in the lone mountain area. The atmosphere is wonderful and the service is fantastic. The fish is fresh and never tastes "funny". The "this guy" roll is my favorite but lots of other wonderful choices on the menu including some non fish options. They have Mochic which is my fav desert! Always friendly and always good. Definitely worth trying.

Everyone needs "their" sushi bar.....and this one is mine! Between the friendly service, quality/fresh fish, and the great AYCE options , this is definitely a great place to enjoy sushi. I always fear writing a great review puts the ease of getting a table at jeopardy , but without support, your favorite place can quickly become a distant memory. So give it a try, enjoy the food, but don't take my spot...lol!

Love this place they have seemed to have gotten busier and food is great. All you can eat is so worth it and reasonable for $27 for dinner, sushi bomb and red rock rolls are my favorite. I am always there once every other week

What happened?! Sushi bomb used to be great. Hate the new menu layout, my favorite roll is gone, I would have paid more for the old menu and quality of fish. Almost gagged when I was served bad uni. SO SO SAD!

**Summary**        - Freshness - The freshness is around average.        - Rice - All the nigiri has way too much rice in them. Anytime I see that, I wonder what other corners the establishment is cutting.        - Service - The sushi chefs were nice, but the waitress had an attitude problem that day. It was almost as if she was scolding me for not knowing that I had to order mussels and other items from the sushi chefs and not her. Furthermore, she never processed my dynamite order.        - Originality - This place has a lot of rolls I've never seen including the Stuffed Tomatoes and This Guy roll.        - Rules - They have more rules than your average sushi joint and some weird names for their sushi (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYAxj5_pV4RnDpe3_5VpA?select=4r09Hm_dz_GKp_GSKIkYvg). **Price**        - $19.95 Lunch AYCE Open - 3:30pm        - $26.95 Dinner AYCE 3:30pm - Close **Ordered**        - This Guy Roll (Tuna & Avocado Roll with a Spicy Soft-Shell Crab Ball with Spicy Garlic Ponzu Sauce) - The ball of spicy soft-shell crab was nice (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYAxj5_pV4RnDpe3_5VpA?select=j8FE2cjU71vIaKhWHD6M9A).        - Stuffed Tomatoes (Imitation Crab Meat, Avocados, Shrimp, wrapped with Salmon with Orgasm Sauce) - No rice in this roll. The sauce was a bit too creamy though (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYAxj5_pV4RnDpe3_5VpA?select=-z1r1fRYJV98K71-ySmxXQ).        - Golden Dragon (Eel and Spicy Tuna on the inside topped with more Eel) - The eel and spicy tuna center made this roll feel like I was eating baby food (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYAxj5_pV4RnDpe3_5VpA?select=SuFaUOaT7v_pAr0E-JubIA).        - Grilled Bacon & Scallop Skewer - This was a great skewer with eel sauce to top it (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYAxj5_pV4RnDpe3_5VpA?select=A9yP1_X_Z0jmV9eu1fuRWQ).        - Grilled Shrimp w/ Vegi Skewer - The shrimp were pretty tiny, but it was good (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYAxj5_pV4RnDpe3_5VpA?select=l5AhXwmWFLr6zxHGrcNmMg).        - Nigiri - The sushi wasn't the freshest I've had in Vegas, but it was decent. However, the sushi is to rice ratio is pretty bad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYAxj5_pV4RnDpe3_5VpA?select=o34ITC4o8tVbZ2Njh8VUmQ).        - Sushi Salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYAxj5_pV4RnDpe3_5VpA?select=MSAhVq4gwgC_RyxERv0xlw)        - Baked Green Mussels - They used some kind of sour sauce instead of eel sauce that made the mussels taste terrible. This was the first time I didn't finish a mussels on my plate ever. **Recommendations**        - If skewers and rolls are what you're looking for, this place isn't too bad. However, if you're thinking of ordering nigiri, you're probably better off going elsewhere.

The customer service is very nice and fast. The food is ok. The sushi grade tuna wasn't cut proper cause the membranes were in. The unami was good just like the chicken teriyaki. Nice to see there's a Japanese restaurant close by but I think the cook needs to add more flavoring next time. Good place to go for lunch during work for something different.

Leaving the house to grab dinner, my friend changed her mind and wanted sushi. It was her birthday weekend so I had to comply. Jumped on Yelp and pleased to find this bar was only 1/4 miles away and had good reviews.  Both of my friends really enjoyed the food here. My sushi palate is a bit more sophisticated so I wasn't as pleased. The service was extremely good but we were also the only customers in the restaurant at the time.  The chef was extremely friendly and talkative. When I ordered some hamachi sushi, he cut me a fantastic piece from the belly. It was excellent. On the other hand, the spicy tuna was not; it was pre-made and very mushy. The hand roll didn't include any yamagobo or even a few pieces of cucumber.  I was also a bit disappointed in their sake selection. I asked for a ginjo sake, but the best they had was unfiltered.

Sushi lovers!  This is your place!  The best part about this place besides the delicious sushi is the all you can eat!  They have lunch and dinner prices and both are reasonable, although I can't think of the prices off the top of my head.  There is a wide variety to pick from and all rolls are amazing! You will defintely leave satisfied!  Customer service is great as well!

I was on this side of town and thought I'd give this place a try. Apparently arriving 15 minutes before the dinner service starts assures you will be paying $7 more for ayce so I opted for ordering 2 rolls. The Japanese lasagne was decent. Although not a large portion. The salmon lover roll was bland and disappointing. The prices are definitely not worth it ordering rolls individually.

This place has been getting better and better since Andy showed up. He's got some great new fish to try like the salmon belly (which they use a blowtorch on!!!), the giant scallop, and the sea bream. Oh my god. I went back twice in a week and did AYCE the second time because it was so good.   Definitely a delicious lunch or dinner spot.

Went there Saturday night (11/2) with some friends.  Had the AYCE.  The service was great.  The selections were not just the normal.  They had Ocean Trout which was very nice along with Giant Clam.  Mmmmmm.  They also offer all you can drink for an extra $6.00 so it is well worth it.  Rather than getting a pitcher, we got glasses, so the beer was always cold. You just had to ask for more beer.    We went early (5:30 ) and by the time we left a little after 7:00 the place was packed.

I must say that the food is great at Sushi Bomb. The problem I am having is with the service. More than once we have been treated like we are lucky to be eating there as opposed to them being happy we are their customers. We eat there at least twice a month, but its starting to get to the point where we no longer enjoy going there.  Not sure if management is aware of what is going on.  Like I said good food, not so good employees.

Done with this place! Have it be lunch or dinner I'm done with this place Togo lunch orders take 40 minutes they'll tell you 20 in the phone then it'll be another 20 when you get there and don't even think of saying anything as they will say your early people only get certain amount of lunch time. Ayce dinner used to be my favorite they are so anal my 5yo touched a edamame I mean just one and they told me u had to pay for an order he's allergic to soy and likes to just open them just petty off my list!!!!!!

Okay so I only go here in a bind when my favorite sushi restaurant is closed because my favorite sushi restaurant I'm Sundays doesn't open until I want to say 4 PM well I came here and I got the unlimited all-you-can-eat sushi which sometimes I don't get it but lately I've been doing that restaurant and I got thee coconut shrimp sushi roll what I was doing the all you can eat one night and I would go back again and again just for this coconut roll shrimp now the  sauce they put on the Coconut Shrimp has a unique texture to it so I'll let you figure it out on your own what you think of the sauce when you see it on your plate and feel it in your mouth but it is amazing .... amazing nothing compares to this roll everything else is just ordinary but this roll is mind boggling

I love sushi bomb!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They have a great have option and servers are attentive. They can get really busy on the weekend but I still come eat whenever my family is in town. Best sushi place in the northwest!!!!
good sushi but a little expensive for the quality. Doesnt stop me from coming though.

Nice, upbeat place.  First visit tonight and we had 4 rolls 4 peaces of sushi with the plum ice cream to top it off.  Staff was nice and friendly with the place having a nice local feel to it.  We'll be back soon.

My favorite sushi place!  It's absolutely delicious!  Plates are beautifully presented, service is quick and friendly.  My favorite:  Screaming O salad.  The chefs up front already start putting it together when we walk in the door...I love it so much.  My daughter loves the Teriyaki chicken entree.  AYCE is the way to go.
My favorite sushi place! The salmon lover is my favorite  and the staff is always super helpful and fun.

Not impressed at all. Service was all over the place and the quality of the fish was mediocre. A lot of the pieces were tough and tasted like it had been frozen. On top of that, both my friend and I that ate there got sick after eating there. The only good note is that the raw oysters weren't bad. but I will definetly not return.

So I've ordered rolls and picked them up a couple of times before for dinner. They were always good! Let me say that myself and husband are not "real sushi" eaters. We're like... beginners. I'm fond of the "snow rabbit and red tiger". The bacon wrapped skewers are amazing. I was craving sushi for lunch and saw that they had the Ayce lunch special for $21. Listen.. it was so good we went twice in one week . You DEFINITELY get your money's worth doing the Ayce because you can pretty much get anything on the menu. Teriyaki chicken.. dessert.. The first time we went it was at 11 30 & service was great. The second time we went it was 12 &  got EXTREMELY busy.The problem was that there was only ONE SERVER.  Why have one server at lunch time? He was absolutely overwhelmed. The service was painfully slow.. people walked out.. there was a lot of complaining. Poor guy. I was irritated but when we FINALLY got our food, it was delicious. I'll definitely be back, but hopefully they won't be understaffed.
Great sushi and great service! Highly recommend the specialty rolls. (Warm Springs and D's Special) We eat here at least once a week!

This place has pretty decent sushi, it doesn't blow my mind, but it's good. What I don't like is the fact that you can't order from the bar. I love sitting at the bar, and every sushi restaurant I have ever been to, you can order from the bar. That's why I sit at the bar, so you can order the moment you're ready to eat again, and not wait on the waitress. Also, they seem to be understaffed every time I go there. Their menu is set up in a strange way, and it was confusing at first to read. I've been there a few times with my husband now, and I can navigate it a little better, but otherwise if my husband didn't like this place and it wasn't closer to home than my favorite sushi places, I probably wouldn't ever go here again.

To begin with, the service was incredible. I had only been in this place two or three times and the hostess and chef remembered me. The fish was fresh, the prices were reasonable, and the atmosphere was relaxed. I've taken a few friends here and each of them have returned on their own. Three items that were good were: garlic tuna, Japanese lasagna, and 007.

Food was good but because we had 10 pieces of sushi left we were charged. We ate most of everything and there was not even close to a full roll left. We only ordered 3 rolls a piece so it wasn't like we over ordered. They lost two good customers because of this nonsense.

Visited this sushi spot for the 1st time last night with my family for my nieces birthday. It was very busy so that was a good sign. They don't take reservations but you can call and tell them what time you'll be there and they'll put your name down at that time so we didn't have to wait too long. That was cool.   It is one of the more expensive all-you-can-eat prices at $27 but they did have a great selection and the sushi was fresh and tasty unlike some AYCE places. They also had on a daily special a Chilean sea bass ,it was amazing. Sucked that we didn't notice it till after we were full but we ordered it anyways. Couldnt pass that up. They also have, if you get the AYCE, Sapporo on draft for $3!   Our service was good. And the people were nice. The only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because it was freezing in there. they said it was something about keeping the fish Fresh,which we were like, well why is it any other sushi place freezing then? It did end up getting turned down halfway through our meal. Thank goodness.  Also, the music was  quite loud making it hard to hear each other. Would definitely come back here.

Food here is outstanding. I've been to about twenty different Sushi places in Vegas, and this is in top 3. All you can eat is surprisingly great, 58 dollars total for two people. Muscles are fantastic, the sushi bomb is good, and staff is fast and friendly.  You can't go wrong, try this place. I was surprised this place doesn't have five stars!

Went here on a Friday for dinner. The service was great everyone was really helpful and attentive. They have a wide variety of sushi selection. I love their rice to fish ratio. Most sushi places use so much rice. I would try their udon noodles, it was amazing. This has to be my go to sushi restaurant. The decor of the whole restaurant is so pretty.

I've been to Sushi Bomb many years ago, but I never went back because i wanted to go to a place that offered half rolls. I'm the type who likes to try different rolls. I decided to come back here with my husband and our seven-year-old, who loves sushi & can eat just as much as me, because we only live about 2-3 minutes away from this sushi joint.   To my pleasant surprise, they now offer half rolls! Woohoo! Guess who was a happy camper that day? Me! We tried Coconut Lover, Love Affair, Sushi Bomb, Japanese Lasagna, Mojave Beach, bacon & scallop skewers, nigiri (tuna, Cajun albacore, salmon, & eel), shrimp tempura, miso soup, and baked green mussels. Everything was delicious. Our absolute favorite was hands down the Coconut Lover. My husband fell in love with it! The nigiri was delicious and fresh. The baked green mussels were PERFECT! Miso soup was just the way my dad makes it - so delicious. And all you can eat bacon & scallop skewers? BOMB! My second favorite is definitely a tie between Love Affair and Mojave Beach! Mojave Beach because it's a mixed of different flavors and textures & it's very light!  We are definitely going to be regulars here. My daughter scarfed down probably 20 pieces of salmon and eel nigiri alone. I can definitely say that this is our new favorite sushi joint!

Awesome. We have been trying to get in here after a karate for a while. We may have foiund our new favorite sushi place. My wife and I both had all you can eat sushi...$27. We thought that was reasonable. The top of the list of items we had were, the Sishi Bomb roll, the White Rabbit and the Red Rock roll. My wife said she would come back for just the Red Rock roll. I agreed.   While it's just lilttle a littleI, The wall, itl is top notch.

Lots of great variety and the sides don't taste the same like other ayce joints. Sushi is always on point so it's definitely worth the 30 mins drive for me. Jennifer is always a delight, giving us the best service ever!

We ordered miso soup and a bunch of appetizers including Cheese Salmon sticks with deep fried asparagus, which took a very long time to cook, it came out much much later than the rest of the food. Agadashi Tofu was grainy and not silky like we are used to, Gyoza was good, Tempura Combo was excellent-light and crispy.   Friend had bento box and said it was fine, nothing special. The lettuce in the salad was all white romaine ribs.   Service was attentive, but disinterested and occasionally overwhelmed. 3 sushi guys up front keep their heads down and keep working. Very serious. Very rarely do they look up or greet customers. A very minor mumble for one customer they re

This is one of our go to places. Especially when we are super hungry and wanting to indulge in All-You-Can-Eat.  The sushi is good quality, especially for being in Las Vegas, and what you are going to pay.  I have never gotten sick from here, and I keep going back to take that for what it is worth.   I think they have very good specialty rolls, and there is a lot of selection available to you. I also really like that I can order half orders of rolls when doing AYCE to that I can sample more types of rolls.   They have a good selection of everything you could need/want for a sushi night.   The place is smaller, but there is plenty of seating.  It does get crowded so if you are going during a high time, you will likely need to wait a little bit.   The only reason it is 4 not 5 is mainly the service.  it is not bad, but not stellar either.   I will continue to go back, and if you are in the area I would give it a shot.

I've eaten here a few times over the years because it's close by and its pretty good. I usually order the same thing no matter what sushi restaurant I go to. Edaname, Philadelphia roll, and Japanese lasagna. I do enjoy their Japanese lasagna, best I've had anywhere. Service can be a little slow. I'm not quite sure why I'm even reviewing this place since I'm not a sushi expert.
I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant. The seaweed was tough and the sushi did not seem very fresh. The tempura veggies were pretty good.

We have been here a couple of times in the past. It is not bad Not my favorite but it is good.  My Son goes here all the time and he has ordered some different rolls that I tried which are not to bad but I am not into going to a Sushi place to pay for AUCE to pay for a ton of rice They use a lot of rice sometimes when making the rolls.. So I would rather pic some of the items that don't come with too much rice.  The fish tastes fresh and the service seems to be pretty good the times I have been here. It does seem to be a little more busy than the place down the road that I have been to a lot more which is a bit cheaper too.  I love sushi and sometimes its nice to have someone suggest what to try until I have been there a few times.

The food here was definitely the BOMB!!  Everything was so flavorful and absolutely delicious!!  The service was impeccable!!  The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because I think their all you can eat price is a little high.  It's $27 when most places charge $20-$25.  But I'm really not complaining because the food and service are really good. I will definitely go there again.  My 2nd time here and it was just as good as the first. I upgraded them to 5 stars. I cannot say enough great things about this place!!!  Everything was so good!!!  I'm still full and I want to go back.  I especially loved the bacon wrapped scallops!!  Service was also great this time too.  My sushi place from now on!!!

Honestly, this is my favorite sushi place in all of Vegas! They have the best service with a small restaurant feel. My husband and I would have lunch and dinner here all the time when we lived in the northwest part of town. They have a peanut butter roll that is hands down the best!! Must try!

Decided to try this place based on other positive reviews here.  I tried the Warm Springs Roll, the 007 roll, a spicy tuna roll, and I had the honey toast for dessert.  The sushi was very fresh and quite tasty compared to other sushi joints in Las Vegas. The staff were very friendly and service was prompt. I enjoyed the decor as well, including the paper lanterns.

This place I frequent and is virtually the only sushi place I go to. They get busy.... Yes, but their quality, convenience and cleanliness is worth it.  I've tried a ton of rolls from here (worth doing all you can eat for $27 at dinner) My favorite though, Is the shrimp roll. It has cooked shrimp both inside, outside and avocado on top with eel sauce. The spicy deep fried jalapeño one is also a stand out.  The only thing I'm not a fan of is the mochi. It always has a taste about it that I'm not fond of. As if it hasn't been separated from the garlic or other seasonings in the freezer. Other than that.... Spot on.

The coconut lover roll was good , the summerlin pkwy and baked salmon did not taste as good as I thought it would have. In fact, taste didn't differ from each other. They both tasted like the same thing, must of been the topping or sauce. Service was ok, a little slow.

Yum...yum...yum!!!!  We decided to try the restaurant after reading the reviews and I am so glad we did.  The lunch All You Can Eat is only $21 and the rolls are delicious.  The restaurant is very clean and has a relaxed atmosphere.  This is now one of my favorites.  Pleasantly surprised!!!

I've been going to this place for years. I've tried everything on the menu and they have never let me down. My wife and I love the food. She especially likes the spicy garlic edamame, which goes great with the quality sushi they serve. If you like to drink, add $4 to the price of your all you can eat sushi and you get unlimited saporo on draft. You can't beat it

The food is very good, the service is not!! Took us forever to get our food, server very rarely checked on us. They are like sushi police unnecessarily. Environment is uncomfortable due to them being overly paranoid. They've never offered frequent diner card, had to ask for one. We are return customers because the food is very good, but we will definitely try to find a new spot.

I ordered all you can eat sushi. Found a really long black hair deep in my spicy tuna (after putting it in my mouth) and was absolutely disgusted. When one of the waiters came by with the other sushi I ordered, I attempted to show him the roll with the hair still in it. He wouldn't give me the time of day. Asked if I ordered the roll he was holding. I attempted to show him the hair & let him know I didn't want the roll or any of his food. A girl came over & she didn't care about the hair either. I don't have a problem paying for my food, but I'm disappointed they didn't care, there was no apology, they left the rest of my table alone, and they charged me for the first roll. Super disappointed. The service wasn't great either, usually isn't but I overlook it taking into consideration that they get busy. Not my problem! Won't ever go back there.

For the price and options you receive for the all u can eat is not worth it. The good thing about this place is it's near by and it's not in a high traffic location and that's it. I'm pretty sure I got food poisoning by eating their raw fish. I've never gotten this gut wrenching feeling from any sushi restaurant I've eaten.

We live in the area and over the last couple of years, some friends recommended Sushi Bomb. Normally, we go to Sushi Fever on West Sahara, which is fairly legendary.  So last night I finally gave Sushi Bomb a try.  I have to be honest, it was very underwhelming.  The quality of the rolls were on par with what you would buy in a grocery store deli.  The sushi is not terrible, but it's mediocre at best.  The ingredients were not as good as the place we normally go to (Sushi Fever). While the prices at Sushi Bomb were slightly lower than Sushi Fever, the difference in quality leaves Sushi Fever as the overall better value.  The decor and ambiance is cool though.  And the staff was attentive and friendly.
DJ roll & salmon poke is amazing! The roll is about $13 and very filling. Also the service is great. I'll be coming back for sure!
This has become our go-to Sushi place. The AYCE lunch is an excellent deal. We get half rolls go we can try as many new selections as our tummies can handle.

Sushi Bomb has really good sushi with tons of variety. It's better if you slowly enjoy your food instead of stuffing all in your face and take your time savoring their sushi with each roll you order. Sushi Bomb also has good daily specials and bomb appetizers.
Third time here. Great meals. Beautiful presentation and a very courteous staff. Highly recommend this place.
This place should be called Bomb Sushi, cause everything is bomb and delicious!. Will definitely go back!!

Been here a couple times in the past couple of weeks. Sushi is still tasty but the three stars is for the service or lack of.  Each recent visit the bomb has been busy but the service on the floor can't keep up. From the basic checking on drinks to reordering the staff does not seem to have any organization. Our table had every server wait on us - because we had to flag them down  Even after 4 of our party of six left (full) we waited for 15 min and THEN had to ASK for our check.  And they added the gratuity well above the level of service we received  Been one of my favorites but they better get their service together. Lots of choices out there.

Good food, bad service. It's very hard for me to return to places with bad service. There are plenty of other sushi places I can go and not wait 47 minutes to get the check and/or a water refill. Probably won't be returning.

New ownership, new management, better service! The food is still good! They no longer serve the Kiss My Ass roll, but the Golden Dragon is a nice substitute.   The Sushi Bomb roll, spicy garlic edamame, pork belly, and the sea bass are all recommended. They also have Honey Toast, which is delicious pretty much everywhere.   I'm glad I can recommend my favorite sushi place again!
